Job Description:
Absolute is looking for an entry-level technician who wants to grow with our
company, is career minded and loves to travel. You will begin working for
Absolute by participating in our thriving training program in Worcester,
Massachusetts.

This is a long-term growth opportunity that will expand your skillset and
challenge you for years to come. Absolute Robot and sister company Absolute
Haitian are industry leaders with an expanding customer base in the United
States.

 **You will begin your career at Absolute by**

  * Spending a couple of months learning to set up, install and service our robotic equipment, then broaden your knowledge base by working on injection molding equipment in our Worcester, MA headquarters.
  * Shadowing our field service techs on installation and service calls throughout the Northeast and possibly the rest of the US.

 **After training is completed, you will**

  * Begin installing and troubleshooting our equipment on your own, starting with robots and smaller machinery, then gradually adding our larger injection molding machinery.
  * After your training in Massachusetts has concluded you will relocate back to North Carolina and travel within the region and the rest of the US 100%.

  * There are opportunities to relocate to another region of the US.

 **Qualifications**

  * Associate's degree in mechanical engineering or related field
  * Ability to read and interpret electrical, mechanical and hydraulic drawings
  * Ability to use hand tools and various hydraulic, mechanical and electrical test equipment
  * Previous internship in engineering field is helpful
  * You MUST be able to travel up to 100%

 _ **YOU MUST BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE US WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP.**_

RIOS is a technology company helping global customers automate their
factories, warehouses, and supply chain operations by deploying a new class of
AI-powered and dexterous robots. RIOS robots handle hard-to-automate tasks,
typically requiring human-level dexterity, in unstructured environments. RIOS
is headquartered in Palo Alto, CA and has a pilot facility in San Carlos, CA.
More information is available at www.rios.ai

 **The Role**

RIOS is looking for an Robotics Controls Development Engineer that can own the
application logic and related robotics controls pipeline development for
various customer use cases. This typically will include leveraging existing
pipeline tools in different ways, along with a degree of custom development,
to meet customer KPI's.

 **As a Robotics Controls and Development Engineer you will:**

  * Work daily on multiple robot platforms with custom hardware and software stacks
  * Push hardware and technology limits to solve real-world problems.
  * Work with a multidisciplinary team to solve previously unsolvable robotics problems
  * Travel to customer sites to deploy robotic solutions.

 **Technical attributes of candidates may include:**

  * M.S./Ph.D. in Robotics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent industry experience)
  * Experience with Robot Operating System (ROS) Proficiency with robotics hardware and systems (e.g., electrical, mechanical, sensing)
  * Experience with C/C++, Python
  * Familiarity with aspects of robotic control including 3D perception, path planning, kinematics, etc.
  * Best practices in software development such as documentation, version control, testing and reproducibility
  * Experience with real-time operating system
  * Actively practice the Git-based CI/CD workflow

 **Perks**

  * Competitive salary package & Stock options for every employee
  * Healthcare + dental + vision insurance plans
  * 401(k) plan
  * Free lunch
  * Flexible time off & paid holidays
  * Social events + happy hours + team parties

Join us!

Job Title: Embedded Systems Engineer / Programmger - Mobile Robotics
Job Description:
**Job Summary:**  
Programmer required for the system design of the Automated Guided Vehicle
(AGV) system for company. This position will require in-depth knowledge of AGV
systems and current technologies in the markerplace. The AGV programmer evelop
software and algorithms that improve how our industrial Automated Guided
Vehicles (AGVs) sense, understand and react. The AGV programmer will be
responsible for performing system design, testing and maintenance. Experience
with the design and implementation of manufacturing control software specific
to AGVs is a must.

C++ programming experience preferred, but Java is also acceptable. Must have
experience working with open source software as well as writing proprietary
software.

We develop a broad range of low level and embedded software powering motion
control, vision, robotics, computing and IOT. You can be involved in the
entire design process, such as discussing requirements with our customers,
writing specifications, conceptual and detailed designing, qualification and
finally releasing for production. We are looking for software engineers with a
strong affinity towards electronics, who are not afraid to open up a
schematics document to customize software for our integrated solutions. If
tuning your applications for different CPU/GPU/FPGA/Hybrid architectures,
multi core/multi CPU and other optimization techniques is what interests you,
join our team as an Embedded Software Engineer!

 **Essential Functions and Responsibilities:**

  * Program and update a system that will provide the required transport of materials by AGV for a given facility.
  * Lead design and programming meetings including other sub-consultants with technical system details for coordination.
  * Discover and correct fatal flaws in system design or revisions by others that may negatively impact system performance.
  * Perform various analyses to create and adjust system design, building spaces and operations.
  * Perform on-site or remote tele-inspections during system installation to adhere to specifications.
  * Creating reports to provide findings and recommendations.
  * Performs other related duties as assigned.
  * Design, develop and test of C++ computer applications
  * Work with real time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded platforms.
  * Strong background in embedded / network software development, and knowledge of Embedded Object-Oriented Development methodologies and approaches.
  * Designing and debugging experience with multi-threading application with embedded systems architecture.
  * Strong code development history using software to solve real-world problems.
  * Working knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
  * Ability to write new mobile robot software features.
  * Ability to write software for real time hardware I/O control and feedback analysis
  * Knowledge of object-oriented design methodologies and design patterns
  * Experience programming serial, CAN and network communications (UDP and TCP)
  * Experience with issue tracking systems, specific experience with Jira is a plus
  * Experience with versions control systems, specific experience with Git/Sub version a plus
  * Experience with writing requirements, design documentation, and test cases
  * Working knowledge of electronic and electromechanical devices such as analog inputs and outputs, encoders, proximity sensors, etc.

 **Knowledge, Education, Skills, and Experience:**

  * Detailed knowledge of AGV systems from all large global manufacturers
  * Knowledge of each vendors components and features including vehicles, navigation systems, and capabilities.
  * Project management and communication skills to provide timely deliverables, develop and maintain client relations, monitor work scope and financials in contract and lead internal effort for assistance.
  * Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that would provide the required knowledge and abilities.
  * Bachelors degree in architecture, engineering or related field and or having performed the required duties with an AGV manufacturer.

  * Requires a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, automation technology, robotics or equivalent work experience.
  * 3-7 years programming experience writing application software using C++ for technical applications.
  * Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded platforms.
  * Ability to troubleshoot software issues in a comprehensive and creative manner.
  * Apply object-oriented design and development techniques, using C++ programming.
  * Assist with version control and release management.

 **What we offer:**

  * Transparent leadership team – business goals and objectives regularly communicated through monthly meetings
  * Opportunity for growth in a booming industry

  * Casual work environment
  * Company culture of continuous improvement
  * On-site or Remote work available

**At Relative Dynamics we value knowledge as a process rather than knowledge
as an answer. Founded in 2011 our goal is to define the new space era by
continuously pushing the boundaries of engineering models services and
technology development. Visit us at www.relativedynamics.space.**

Relative Dynamics Inc. is looking for a **Senior** **Control System Hardware
Engineer** who will work on cutting edge Laser Communications R&D project in
Greenbelt, MD as part of our Advanced Development Group. As a Control System
Hardware Engineer, you are part of a cross-functional team developing optical
terminal hardware. The ideal candidate will have experience leading or
contributing to multiple product development efforts, projects, and
initiatives. This position is located in the Metro DC area.

 **What You'll Get to Do:**

  * Close collaboration with optical, mechanical, control and software engineers to define free-space optical communication system requirements and solutions.
  * Control system design and hardware testing for optical communication terminals driven by high performance while minimizing

size, weight, power, and cost.

 **What You'll Need:**

 **Required:**

  * Bachelor's degree or higher in electrical engineering, or relevant field and/or experience.
  * 5+ years’ experience working on robotic (or similar) control systems.
  * Control system design, simulation, and testing hardware expertise.
  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

 **Desired:**

  * Control system hardware design and testing using precision-positioning motors and piezo-electric transducers
  * Industrial control system product hardware development

 **What You Won't Do:**

  * Feel stuck as we offer great opportunities to advance and learn
  * Feel like a number as we're a close-knit bunch and always have each other’s backs

 **Who You Are:**

  * A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment
  * A quick learner who is always ready to gain depth of knowledge
  * A reliable worker who knows the importance of showing up when it counts
  * Accept assignments with open cooperative positive and team-oriented attitudes
  * Able to plan and execute plans across teams
  * Effective communicator both written and verbal

 **What You'll Enjoy:**

  * Competitive wage and benefits package
  * Medical, dental, vision and life/disability insurance
  * Vacation and paid holidays
  * Tuition reimbursement
  * Great 401k with company match
  * Employee referral program
  * Community involvement investing and giving back to the community

 **Relative Dynamics conducts a comprehensive background check that includes
drug testing. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our
company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national
origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran
status or disability status.**

Knightscope is seeking a senior-level robotics engineer to advance the
capability, efficiency, and robustness of our Autonomous Data Machines (ADMs).
You will help lead a team of engineers in the design, prototyping,
implementation, deployment, and maintenance of ADM platforms and software.
Your knowledge of and experience with robotics hardware, algorithms, software,
and sensors will have significant impact on the capability of our ADMs and the
service they provide to our clients. Knightscope is a fast-paced environment
populated with a highly diverse and passionate team. Your personal drive and
exceptional abilities will help bring Knightscope and its services to the next
level.

 **Responsibilities**

  * Design robot system architectures and algorithms that satisfy client requirements and constraints
  * Perform prototyping in real-world and simulation experiments to validate architecture / algorithm designs and technical approaches
  * Implement architectures, algorithms, and processes in production-level software
  * Support the deployment of software and hardware into new or existing ADMs in the fleet
  * Properly maintain and document all designs, software, and processes
  * Perform troubleshooting to rapidly characterize and address issues within the fleet
  * Lead a sub-team of robotics engineers in fulfilling the above duties, to include tasking, mentorship, and career development
  * Collaborate across the entire Knightscope team to maximize the capability, efficiency, and robustness of our client services.

 **Qualifications**

  * M.S. or higher in robotics related field (e.g. computer science, mechanical engineering, etc.)
  * 5+ years of experience in engineering autonomous robotic systems
  * Experience with robot localization algorithms (e.g. SLAM, AMCL, etc.)
  * Experience with robot navigation and autonomy algorithms (e.g. D*, FSMs, etc.)
  * Experience with Robot Operating System (ROS), including development of custom nodes
  * Programming experience in C++, python, and bash
  * Ability to develop software for embedded Linux systems
  * Working knowledge of software versioning, testing, maintenance, and documentation processes/tools
  * Strong written and verbal communication skills
  * Ability to collaborate with diverse and distributed technical teams
  * Ability to lead diverse and distributed technical teams

 **Nice to Have**

  * Experience with containerized deployment of software (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
  * Experience with 3D localization techniques (e.g. ICP, voxel grids, etc.)
  * Working knowledge of IPC messaging architectures (e.g. XML-RPC, RabbitMQ, etc.)
  * Experience with modifying/debugging operating system components, such as drivers,
  * Experience with LIDARs, cameras, IMUs, GPS, and other localization sensors
  * General knowledge of machine learning concepts and software tools
  * General knowledge of audio and video software pipelines
  * Experience with NVIDIA-based embedded processors (e.g. TX1/2, Xavier, etc.)

 **Location**

  * Remote / Work-From-Home, Washington D.C. area preferred

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex or national origin

Pay: $160,000.00 - $225,000.00 per year

Job Title: Senior Robotics Software Engineer, Motion Planning
Job Description:
Want to join a fun, creative company that is on the cutting edge of
outstanding technologies? NVIDIA is developing groundbreaking solutions in
some of the world’s most exciting technology areas including Virtual Reality,
Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Robotics and Autonomous Vehicles. We
are looking for a Senior Robotics Software Engineer with focus on Motion
Planning to help us build the next generation of our robotics navigation
stack!

**What you will be doing:**

  * Take our navigation stack planning capabilities and features to the next levels 

  * Take ideas from inception to implementation to successful and scalable deployment on robots in real environments 

  * Help define and verify product requirements through detailed analysis, testing and benchmarking both in simulation and test fields 

  * Devise robust systems that works under various conditions (given perception sensor modalities, map availability, environmental conditions, etc) 

  * Thrive in an agile and dynamic environment and use your problem solving skills for building creative solutions in a compute constrained system 

  * Collaborate closely with engineers from other teams and backgrounds including perception and mapping as well as give technical mentorship to junior engineers 

**What we need to see:**

  * MSc/PhD in Robotics, CS, EE or similar fields or BS with equivalent industry experience 

  * 3+ years of proven experience in delivering production-level robotics software on safety critical systems 

  * Practical experience with developing motion planning and control approaches for robots or autonomous vehicles (such as graph search, trajectory optimization, probabilistic robotics, lattice or sampling-based approaches, planning under uncertainty, etc) 

  * Experience writing C++ in a production environment including unit testing, algorithm performance optimization, code review, etc. 

  * Familiarity with scripting languages such as Bash and Python 

**Ways to stand out from the crowd:**

  * Deep understanding of dynamics fundamentals and computational geometry 

  * Capable ability to understand probability, statistics, probabilistic modeling, and linear algebra 

  * Good understanding of learning techniques and data-driven approaches in robotics 

  * Proven experience building safety-critical software architectures 

  * Experience with GPU optimization and Knowledge of CUDA 

With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA
is widely considered to be one of the technology industry's most desirable
employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in
the world working with us and our product lines are growing fast in some of
the hottest fields such as virtual reality, deep learning, artificial
intelligence, graphics virtualization, photo realistic rendering and more.
Come join us at NVIDIA!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an
equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and
future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and
promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,
gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran
status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

**About Us**

Here at ViaBot, we're building a robot made to tackle real-world tasks. We're
a robotics startup based in the heart of Silicon Valley, with a forward-
thinking and exceptional team that's ever-growing. Our aim is to change the
way people see robots--not as gimmicks or as one-trick ponies, but as sensible
solutions to sizable problems. Enter RUNO: an autonomous mobile robot designed
to handle outdoor commercial tasks, such as sweeping and grass cutting. Learn
more about us at: https://www.viabot.com

 **Responsibilities**

ViaBot is looking for a passionate Robotics Software Engineer looking to get
involved with all aspects of the development of autonomous UGVs as a viable
commercial solution. Our ideal candidate is resourceful, hard-working, and not
afraid to get their hands dirty while developing, testing, and maintaining
these bots. They will be responsible for:

  * Hands-on development with our autonomous mobile robot, RUNO
  * Supporting the testing and deployment of our robots onto the field
  * Integration of different sensors and subsystems used on our robot platform RUNO
  * Managing system state both on the microcontroller and Linux levels
  * Exposing diagnostics for both ease of development and for fleet monitoring
  * Optimizing and reduce existing code for both performance and readability
  * Improvising and handling responsibilities outside of the job description

 **Initial tasks will include:**

  * Implementing unit tests on the microcontroller code level for pre-deployment
  * Implementing process tests to be executed remotely and safely
  * Incorporate various sensors with UART-based interfaces
  * Handle many control loops in a single loop-based architecture with limited threading
  * Manage all inter-device messaging over CAN bus
  * Writing health-monitoring nodes in rospy/roscpp to ensure system reliability and ease of debugging
  * Working with our web engineers to expose robot diagnostics and data to our internal web services for fleet management

 **Qualifications:**

  * M.S./B.S. in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
  * Hands-on experience developing robotics, IoT, or computer vision systems
  * Fluency in ROS, C/C++, and software development
  * Experience designing and building software for professional settings
  * Having a vehicle is highly recommended (we do on-site robot maintenance!)
  * Must have work authorization in the United States
  * Not a remote position
  * Must provide proof of vaccination on first day

 **Compensation: $110,000 - $120,000 / yr, plus benefits and stock options**

Sr. Robotics Engineer

Factory Automation Systems is an industrial automation systems integrator that
was founded in 1992. Located in Atlanta, GA, the company provides turnkey
automation solutions to manufacturing companies across the U.S. Our core
expertise includes programmable controllers, information systems, robot
systems, variable speed drives and motion control. We deliver solutions to
customers from diverse industries – building products, automotive, metals,
food processing, chemicals, and more.

FAS specializes in machine tending, material handling and material removal
robotic applications. The company is a Robotics Industries Association (RIA)
certified robot integrator, and FAS is a certified integration partner for
KUKA, FANUC and ABB. Visit www.youtube.com/factoryautomation for videos of
recent robot projects.

We are currently seeking a Senior Robotics Engineer with experience in
manufacturing applications. You will be an integral team member that designs
and implements robot cells. Note: This is not a robot cell maintenance
position - we need a candidate that starts with requirements and a blank sheet
of paper and can design a solution. We are looking for a capable, creative and
self-motivated professional who wants a career in robotic systems integration.

Education: Masters or Bachelors degree in an engineering discipline with
significant work experience in Robotics Engineering. RIA Expert Certification
is a plus.

Description: The Senior Robotic Engineer position requires:

  * Robotic cell design, robot selection and end-of-arm tooling design

  * Robot set-up from system defaults

  * Set-up and use of tool data, frame data and external TCP

  * Use of vision on robot tools and fixed cameras, including understanding of vision tools and calibrations

  * Creation and debug of background tasks

Essential Job Functions:

  * Actively participate in project kick-off meetings. Obtain a clear understanding of the scope and schedule from the project manager, customer and project team.

  * Manage schedules to adhere to the development goals and timelines

  * Provide planning and status information to the project manager

  * Support installation and perform system start-up

Skills Required:

  * Excellent written, verbal, analytical and interpersonal communication

  * Detail oriented with excellent follow-up skills

  * Flexible and able to work with priority and schedule changes

Factory Automation Systems is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free
workplace. The company offers competitive compensation based on skills and
experience. FAS has a comprehensive benefits package with medical and dental
insurance, life insurance, paid vacation, paid holidays and a 401(k) plan with
company matching. Travel is estimated at 15 – 25%.

www.factoryautomation.com

youtube.com/factoryautomation

**Job Title:** **Controls/Robotics Engineer,** of Manufacturing Technology

 **FLSA Status:** Exempt

 **Reports to:** Vice President, of Manufacturing Technology

  
As a **Controls Engineer** , you will perform Controls Engineering and
validation of complex automation machinery through review, design, support,
communication and execution of control systems. Successfully manage multiple
application projects as a Controls Engineer with strong knowledge in robot
applications. Functional experience with PLC Programs, HMI's, Networking,
robotics, and networking. Ability to design and debug complex machinery
applications. Functional experience working with engineering design projects
and machine startup and test systems.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

  * Develop new machinery, and hardware used for the control and monitoring of automated manufacturing equipment. This includes but is not limited to PLCs, robots, safety, HMIs, SCADA, network, vision and motion control.
  * Support plant equipment startup and debug by working with third party system integrators.
  * Develop request for proposals to include control reliable secure architectures.
  * Communicate with suppliers and guide their controls engineering departments on detailed implementations.
  * Perform Factory and Site Acceptance testing to validate equipment controls systems functionality.
  * Perform onsite training for operational personnel.
  * Support multiple plants to resolve complex controls failures and drive to long term resolution with supplier.
  * Determine ways to take full advantage of new controls technologies to design world-class automation controls standards that minimize development time, commissioning time, and unplanned downtime.
  * Write and own the standards, specifications, and procedures that must be followed both internally and by external vendors designing manufacturing equipment for Champion.
  * Build out libraries of modular code and templates that will be used as the building blocks for Champion manufacturing equipment across the entire company.
  * Create tools to automate various steps in the development and deployment process such as scripts for auto-generating PLC code or HMI screens.
  * Design network topology that optimize the equipment for remote accessibility, diagnostics, backups, data collection, and cybersecurity.
  * Architect, write, and debug PLCs using Ladder Logic and/or Structured Text with an emphasis on generating code that is organized, structured, documented, maintainable and reusable.
  * Generate user HMI and SCADA screens that are user-friendly, intuitive and suitable for operating and troubleshooting equipment.
  * Specify (ANSI/RIA15.06/OSHA compliant) control reliable safety systems for safeguarding robots, gantries, conveyors, and other high volume manufacturing equipment.
  * Design the interfaces for interaction between the manufacturing equipment and supervisory level systems such as the factories Manufacturing Execution System (MES).
  * Validate these internally developed standards and tools on production-representative lab equipment and virtual simulations to ensure high quality and robust behavior.

 **Qualifications**

  * S. in Mechanical / Electrical Engineering, or equivalent
  * 4+ years of manufacturing or relevant experience (new line launches a plus)
  * Familiarity with common controls hardware components used in high volume manufacturing.
  * Hands-on experience integrating high volume manufacturing equipment.
  * In-depth knowledge of Safety standards (ANSI/RIA15.06, OSHA).
  * In-depth knowledge of Electrical Standards (NFPA79, National Electric Code, UL508A)
  * Experience developing electrical schematics using EPLAN, AutoCAD Electrical, or similar.
  * In depth knowledge of the configuration, performance, and limitations of industrial PLCs
  * Advanced proficiency programming industrial equipment using various IEC 61131-3 languages.
  * Experience developing company standards and resuable code for programming Allen Bradley PLCs.
  * Experience developing company standards and reusable templates for equipment HMIs using FactoryTalk View, Ignition, Studio 5000 Logix, HMI, and other AB products.
  * Experience programming industrial 6-axis robots such as Fanuc, Kawasaki, ABB, Kuka, etc. is preferred.
  * Experience designing topologies for and troubleshooting common fieldbus networks such as Ethernet/IP, EtherCAT, or Profinet.
  * Knowledge of communications between machine PLCs and database systems
  * Experience interfacing manufacturing equipment with Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES).
  * Ability to travel 50% of the time during critical launch phase.
  * Functional safety knowledge is a plus.

 **  
Physical Demands** The physical demands described here are representative of
those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential
functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable
individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required
to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and

_Controls Engineer for Machine Builds - Minimal Travel_  
 **About the company:**

Advanced Mechatronics Corp specializes in the designing and building of new
custom machinery. Our shop produces efficient automated machines,
workstations, tooling, and more, all custom built in-house to accommodate the
customer's individual needs. Every project we have is unique and comes with
its own set of challenges. This prevents work from becoming repetitive and
boring, making AMC a captivating company to work for.

We serve several industries including but not limited to Automotive,
Pharmaceutical, Manufacturing, Material Processing, Agriculture, Weld
Assembly, and Quality Control.

We are located in Norton Shores, Michigan, between Grand Haven and Muskegon.
We are a successful and growing company seeking motivated individuals with a
positive attitude. This is a full-time, immediate opening, first shift
position.

We are seeking a Controls Engineer who will be responsible for designing,
programming, robotics and supporting custom equipment builds.

  * Document responsibilities and actions to maintain accurate records of project accountabilities.
  * Monitor and control objectives, costs, and timetables of project design and development.
  * At times you will also have the opportunity to work hands-on with the machines, and in some occasions be required to travel to the customer facilities.
  * Most travel is local to the West Michigan area within approximately a 70 mile radius of Muskegon. No overnight stays required.

Working knowledge and skill set including:

RedZone Robotics provides wastewater asset management solutions using clear
and concise data to guide asset managers in critical infrastructure decision.
We understand the cost of infrastructure failures and shepherd leaders in the
process that protect their communities with the most efficient and economical
solutions. We believe that what lies underground directly affects the
communities that live above. Our process, from inspection to data delivery, is
guided by the belief we all deserve a safe place to live, work, play, and grow
old.

As a Robotics Engineer with a sensor focus, you will work with RedZone
engineering teams to define, build, and execute strategic system development
programs focused on building robots and payloads aligned with the company’s
vision of the future.

The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and
creative solutions to industry specific challenges by staying up to date with
best practices and emerging trends in sensors and sensor modalities. This
individual will thrive in an environment that requires strong problem-solving
skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team
collaboration and open communication. The ideal candidate will be able to
advocate for system improvements to company leadership and work closely with
the Engineering teams to address issues before they reach our valued
customers. They will also have experience in a fast-paced and innovative
environment where needs and requirements can change rapidly.

Duties and Responsibilities include:

  * Develop sensor requirements documents for different sensors.
  * Work with suppliers to gather information, test/evaluate sensor performance.
  * Develop and document sensor interfaces for electrical, signal, and SW interfaces.
  * Perform integration of sensor systems to both legacy and new systems.
  * Work well in cross-functional teams as well as independently.
  * Interact and communicate with non-technical users.
  * Make recommendations for potential hardware or software improvement.

Skills and Competencies:

  * Deep understanding of the principles of GNSS, IMU, Lidar and Camera.
  * Experience in sensor development and packaging for industrial mobile platforms.
  * Understanding of common communication protocols such as UDP TCPIP, ROS Transport, etc.
  * Experience with concepts such as Test-Driven Development and Clean Architecture are a plus.
  * Experience mapping out requirements.
  * Strong communication skills (written and verbal), ability to deliver message concisely and effectively.
  * Strong propensity to listen and ask the right questions of customers and the organization.
  * Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.
  * Demonstrate strong proficiency in emotional intelligence – being able to maintain composure and communicate with tact in challenging situations.
  * Ability to build and maintain interpersonal relationships, and influence at all levels of an organization. Developing constructive and cooperative working relationships with others and maintaining them over time. Proactively reach outside the primary area of responsibility to solve conflicts or issues.
  * Capability to partner with company’s leaders to understand & drive overall cross-functional and business needs.
  * Experience working on an Agile development team is a plus.
  * Learn quickly, adapt easily to changing technology/circumstances, and apply change management skills appropriately. Use creative planning and resource management skills to meet complex schedule, skills mix, cost, and personnel issues.
  * Support high peak resource demands proactively without compromising quality.
  * Ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
  * Analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
  * Identifying the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.
  * Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize work accordingly
  * Self-motivated and pro-active.
  * Demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities.

Education and Qualifications:

  * BS or MS in Robotics, Electrical, Software or related field of study.
  * 5+ years’ experience.
  * DC, Signal, C/C++, Python, Robotic Operating Systems.

  * Ability to travel up to 10% or as needed.

Do you like robotics and want make a positive impact on the direction of new
technologies in consumer products? We are seeking a creative and motivated
Systems Quality Robotic Automation Engineer with excellent analytical,
programming, problem-solving and communication skills to join our Systems
Quality team that works to ensure world-changing products are delivered at a
high-quality to all our customers. Come join our team, where you will build
robotic solutions to test Apple products, ensuring their outstanding quality
before they reach customers!

## **Key Qualifications**

  * Proficiency creating and using robotics/mechatronics to build automated solutions.
  * Proficiency in coding (preferably Python).
  * Proficiency with CAD tools like NX or Solidworks.
  * Experience working with a wide range of sensors and actuators.
  * Experience building circuits/systems that interface with sensors and actuators.
  * Experience working with development boards like Arduino.
  * Ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
  * Strong attention to detail and strive for the best product for our customers.
  * Ability to work in teams and collaborate.

## **Description**

\- Design, engineer, maintain, and run robotic automated test systems,
incorporating actuators, sensors and software to interface, trigger and sense
hardware and software features in Apple products. - Design components for
robotic automation using CAD tools, and generate their drawings for
fabrication. - Analyze automation results, and use them to regress, isolate,
report and quantify the impact of all issues found. - Collaborate with
engineering, QA & program management teams to plan and deliver the most
effective and impactful ways to test and solve short and long-term problems. -
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to run experiments and analyze their
data in order to drive positive change in Apple products. - Advocate for the
customer and drive for the highest quality at all levels of the product. -
Develop and maintain clean test automation frameworks and test cases. - Report
status on a regular basis and meet target times.

## **Education & Experience**

\- BS in ME, EE, CE, CS, or equivalent engineering degree (MS preferred)

## **Additional Requirements**

  * Nice to have:
    * Experience in computer vision (openCV).
    * Experience with applied mathematics (e.g. linear algebra, transformation matrices).
    * Experience with coding apps for iOS.
    * SQA or System Test experience, preferably on consumer-facing HW/SW products.
    * Experience with Machine Learning.
    * In-depth understanding of iOS, OS X, or Unix.
  * If you are a Colorado resident, this is for you: At Apple, we see the whole you. We carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors, including your background and experience. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary. Systems Quality Robotics Automation Engineer starts at a minimum hourly rate of $39.08/hr. The actual pay may be higher depending on your skills, qualifications, and experience. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Every Apple employee also has the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder, because all team members are eligible for stock grants and also a discount when purchasing Apple stock.
  * We offer all kinds of ways to experience well-being, confidence, and satisfaction. Learn more about Apple benefits.

  * Solid mathematical foundation of machine learning and deep learning techniques

algorithms Optimizing these algorithms for real time and low power constraints

**POSITION SUMMARY:**

Research and present recommendations to management on software and hardware
required to develop a totally computer-controlled manufacturing environment.
Integrate robotic systems, machinery controls and computer networks into
operating system. Provide integration with video systems for use in quality
control, safety devices, process data collection and machinery control. Design
electronics for new machinery and write circuitry, software, logic and
operations manuals for equipment. Provide 24/7 support and guidance for
technical issues within job scope, as required.

  

**FUNCTIONS:**

  * Integrate pneumatic devices and Programmable Logic Controllers into control systems, which operate production machinery and facility equipment. Design circuitry to relieve all stored energy for emergency stops and OSHA compliance.

  * Develop programs for automated systems utilizing PLC Ladder Logic and windows-based programs such as Visual basic and cell controllers, integrating all devices into fully communicating networks. Design electrical engineering of automation systems.

  * Troubleshoot and install ancillary machinery systems including computers, PLCs, vision systems, pneumatics, hydraulics, power transmission systems and any other means of power transmission or control.

  * Assist machinery maintenance personnel with troubleshooting control systems and automation needs, including currently installed and experimental systems.

  * Interact with consultants, sales, and technical representatives of suppliers on the above as needed and provide recommendations.

  * Develop and conduct training as required to operate and maintain systems. Provide technical data on installed systems and future needs systems.

  * Plan, install, customize, and maintain hardware and software utilized by end users to ensure optimization and performance of the integrated system. 

  * Responsible for creation and maintenance of all related operator manuals, schematics, and inventory databases.

Treeswift is building robots to operate in the world’s most complex
environments. We are looking for a Robotics Engineer to build the systems and
algorithms which enable our robots to fly underneath the forest canopy and
extract actionable forest metrics. Robotics encompasses the state estimation,
mapping, planning, and control for robot autonomy in cluttered forest
environments. It also entails the multi-robot coverage and planning algorithms
to enable large scale coverage of forest environments. As a member of the
Robotics team, you will design, implement, and field test advanced robotics
algorithms on real systems in the most exciting and challenging environment,
the forest.

We are a mission-driven company that places our customer needs front and
center. As a result, some days will feature heavy development in the lab, and
other days will feature rigorous testing in customer forests. We are solving
problems that no one has solved before, so having an innovative mindset with
an excitement for diving deep into the messiness of real-world robotics is
critical.

You will:

  * Develop state-of-the-art algorithms in one or all of the following areas: SLAM, multi-sensor fusion, LiDAR perception, computer vision, deep learning, multi-robot coverage and planning etc.
  * Travel to field deployments with the goal of fast iteration cycles between development and field testing.
  * Benchmark and evaluate algorithm improvement against clearly defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to quantify algorithm effectiveness.
  * Be asked to learn and work on problems you may never have worked on before.

What we look for::

  * The team operates in a production setting both in the field and on the cloud. The ideal candidate has strong software engineering skills and the ability to write production level code (unit tests, debugging/profiling, version control).
  * The ideal candidate should be proficient in Linux, ROS, C++, Python, git, and have experience with drones, LiDAR, and camera sensors.
  * The team works with physical systems in rugged environments, so familiarity with field deployment is ideal.
  * The ideal candidate is willing and excited to travel around the United States and the world to customer sites for extended periods of time.

We expect you to:

  * Be direct and unafraid to voice your opinion succinctly.
  * Have a clear understanding of your own strengths and weaknesses, and seek to help the team based on your strengths, and learn from others to improve your weaknesses.
  * Be truth-seeking and scientific in your approach, but also efficient and have a get-things-done attitude.
  * Thrive in a dynamic, diverse, team-oriented environment.
  * Be open to criticism and feedback.
  * Have high standards and levels of excellence - we are a team of world-class roboticists, data scientists, and foresters, and we like to work with the best.

**About Blue River Technology**

We're Blue River, a team of innovators driven to radically change agriculture
by creating intelligent machinery. We empower our customers to implement more
sustainable solutions: optimize chemical usage, reimagining routine processes,
and improving farming yields year after year. We believe that focusing on the
small stuff – pixel-by-pixel and plant-by-plant - leads to big gains. By
partnering with John Deere, we are innovating computer vision, machine
learning, robotics and product management to solve monumental challenges for
our customers.

Our people are at the heart of what we do. Through cross-discipline
collaboration, this mission-driven and daring team is eager to define the new
frontier of robotics. We are always asking hard questions, rapidly iterating,
and getting our boots in the field to figure it out. We won't give up until
we've made a tangible and positive impact .

  

**Position Description**

We are looking for a self-driven senior robotics engineer to help design and
build tools for supporting our perception stack, software debugging and data
workflow for machine learning systems. This software stack empowers the team
to develop the next generation of machine learning products and robotics
systems. The candidate will be responsible for integrating research work into
the product as well as testing it on the platform end to end. This position
will involve close collaboration with the product and engineering team to
implement and track the metrics for different components of the system. The
candidate should be comfortable working on Agriculture and Construction
machinery in a field environment.

**Job Responsibilities**

  * Robotics software development and system support activities for image-based object detection on real-time systems. This includes working on various parts of the classical computer vision pipeline for detecting objects using stereo cameras, fusing detections from different modalities and system testing on target platforms.
  * Design and implement tools for machine learning activities such as model training, model inference, model evaluation and model introspection related debugging tools.
  * Implement product metrics and evaluation tools for analytics and reporting that enables the engineering and product team to track and improve product performance over time.
  * Design and implement tools for data collection such as data capture, data logging, data visualization, etc.
  * Support the improvements of data workflows including data ingestion, data labeling, model training and model evaluation for machine learning systems working with large volumes of data.

  

**Required Skills & Experience**

  * MS in Computer Science or other specialties such as Robotics, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Data, etc with 3+ years of industry experience.
  * Strong expertise in writing modern and production quality C++ and Python code for robotics and CVML systems and setting the standard for code quality across engineering teams
  * Desire and passion to work in a fast-paced, production oriented environment
  * Self-driven/enthusiastic/motivated to solve exciting engineering problems
  * Excellent interpersonal skills
  * Mission aligned to improve safety and productivity of the equipment.
  * Ability to work effectively within a geographically-distributed team

**Desired Skills & Experience**

  * Experience in working with data workflows for machine learning such as AWS, Kubeflow and other ML Ops platforms
  * Experience in working with Vehicle autonomy space.
  * Experience in working with GPUs and FPGAs
  * Experience in build and release systems, artifactory, jenkins etc
  * Experience in metrics implementation, analysis and dashboarding

  

We are looking for people who are passionate about solving challenging
engineering problems to improve the safety and productivity of agriculture and
construction equipment by applying cutting edge computer vision, machine
learning and robotics technologies.

Blue River offers competitive compensation and benefits, including a great
401(K) match. We believe in a work life balance and offer generous Paid Time
Off and Sick Leave as well as Paid Parental Leave and an adoption benefit.
Subsidized lunches, flexible work hours, CalTrain passes (with mobile Wi-Fi!)
and a collaborative and supportive environment also contribute to making Blue
River a great place to work.

In this role, you will work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to develop

At Torc, we have always believed that autonomous vehicle technology will
transform how we travel, move freight, and do business.

**About the Role:**

Our Perception teams are responsible for developing perception algorithms to
detect and perceive objects for Torc's autonomous driving systems, allowing
the system to understand and react to the environment around the vehicle in
real-time. Perception team members create software to utilize algorithms that
use sensor data from LiDAR, RADAR, and cameras to detect, classify, segment,
and detect, and track obstacles in the vehicle's surrounding environment.
Perception software utilizes 3D point cloud data from LiDAR and objects
detected in radar returns to create a situational awareness for our behaviors
and path planning teams to make vehicle decisions to navigate safety. We work
closely with other engineering teams in behavior and motion planning to create
innovative solutions for our Level 4 autonomous system.

In this role engineers are responsible for various software development and
engineering activities supporting the delivery of autonomy algorithm software
to the overall system solution within Perception area utilizing computer
vision and machine learning techniques and skill set.

  * Responsible to complete software assignments including but not limited to software design, implementation, unit testing, vehicle testing and deployed software maintenance.
  * Assist in root cause analysis of issues found in vehicle testing
  * Support team in identifying daily assignments and reporting progress at daily stand ups.
  * Support software and system level test plans and verification strategies to support ongoing feature development and bug fixes.
  * Responsible to ensure software updates do not regress the software performance by utilizing simulation software and scenarios.
  * Update simulation software and scenarios for new features or situations encountered in testing software
  * Passion for autonomy development and testing
  * Exhibit Torc Values: Hungry, Humble, People Smart
  * Communicate well in a team environment being able to clearly articulate progress, design expectations and support needed to help the team accomplish goals.
  * Flexibility and adaptable in our fast paced environment
  * Continuous learning mind-set

  * Proficient in working with deep learning frameworks like (Pytorch or TensorFlow) and TensorRT
  * Experience with end to end computer vision development pipeline which includes researching the novel approach, developing the model to and make it production ready.
  * Hands-on experience with Perception Sensors such as Camera (required) and Lidar (optional).
  * Professional level proficiency in modern C++ programming language and experience with C++ development stack.

**Preferred Skills**

  * Working knowledge and experience developing within Scrum or Kanban workflow.
  * Working knowledge of advance modern C++ programming language features and experience with CUDA (GPU Programming) programming a plus.
  * Experience with Lidar/Camera calibration development is a plus.

**Required Years of Experience and Competencies**

  * Bachelor's degree, or foreign degree equivalent, in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Robotics Engineer, Mechanical Engineering, or engineering equivalent.
  * Minimum **8 years** ' experience relevant industry experience in robotics, autonomy software engineering; Minimum **5 years** ' experience with relevant Master level degree; Minimum **2 years** with relevant PhD Degree.

**Introduction**

At Altius, our vision is to enable a future where thousands of people live and
work in space, tapping the resources of our solar system for the benefit of
humanity. As part of the effort to make that vision become reality, Altius is
currently developing modular interfaces for satellite servicing, dust tolerant
tool changers for planetary and harsh environment robotics and docking and
refueling systems for space tugs and human lunar landers.

A key ingredient in all these systems is Altius's electropermanent magnet
(EPM) technology, which uses high-power pulsed electromagnets to reprogram
permanent magnet arrays, creating a solid-state switchable magnet that
combines the no-power hold capabilities of permanent magnet Halbach arrays
with the rapid control of electromagnetic systems.

To support a growing number of EPM projects, Altius is expanding its EPM
development team, and is seeking an engineer with experience developing
advanced magnetics hardware, to work in a fast-paced team environment on R&D,
prototyping, and production of cutting edge EPM-enabled space systems.

**Job Description and Duties**

We are seeking an experienced R&D engineer to support the development of
custom EPM systems for aerospace and terrestrial customers. While due to the
niche nature of EPMs, we do not expect a candidate to start with experience
with electropermanent magnets, the goal is for the candidate with enough prior
magnetic system design and analysis experience to grow to a point where they
can lead the development of at least the magnetic circuit portion of custom
EPM devices with minimal technical support from our EPM Development Lead.

Some specific duties for this job include:

  * Gathering and documenting customer requirements, and supporting basic systems engineering for EPM systems.
  * Supporting the design, magnetics analysis, manufacturing, and testing of EPM systems, especially magnetic circuit elements.
  * Help document our EPM development process, including capturing lessons learned.
  * Develop and refine EPM-related analytical tools, including magnetic FEM simulations.
  * Supporting the protection of EPM-related intellectual property, including providing technical inputs for patent applications.
  * Supporting technical recruiting for the EPM team.

**Required Qualifications**

  * A bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Physics, Mechanical Engineering, or related disciplines. A Master’s degree or PhD in a relevant field, especially with relevant academic or industry research experience in magnetics system is preferred.
  * Experience designing, analyzing, prototyping, and testing magnetic components involving magnetic circuits (e.g. EPMs, magnetic workholding chucks, magnetic gears, solenoids, electric motors, magnetic latches or clutches, etc.).
  * Experience with magnetic circuit analysis, including both hand calculations and magnetic/electromagnetic FEM (Ansys Maxwell experience preferred).
  * Familiarity with soft and hard magnetic materials and their properties.
  * Desire to work hands-on, both independently and as part of a team, throughout the development and production phases of the EPM product development life cycle.
  *  **Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.**

**Desired** **Attributes**

In addition to required experience, Altius is also looking for a candidate
with the following personal characteristics:

  * Highly focused/self-starter, who does not need a lot of supervision once given a task.
  * Likes solving problems, not just performing tasks.
  * Loves both researching new technologies and getting their hands dirty building and testing real hardware.
  * Loves learning and teaching new technical skills.
  * Methodical, with a high attention to details, and good at taking detailed notes.
  * Loves designing and building hardware, but who also knows how to and enjoys communicating with customers and other team members.

**Desired** **Skills and Experience**

Beyond the required experience and attributes, Altius would also be interested
in candidates with experience in one or more of the following areas:

  * Previous experience with designing electropermanent magnetic systems.
  * Full-cycle PCB design, fabrication, and testing experience, including virtual simulation using EDA tools (Altium preferred).
  * High-power, high-voltage, and/or pulsed power electronics.
  * Experience with 3D solid modeling (SolidWorks preferred), including producing manufacturing drawings using geometric dimensioning and tolerancing.

**Compensation and Benefits**

Altius anticipates a salary that is very competitive to market pay rates,
depending strongly on the candidate’s skills and experience. Benefits that
come with this position include medical, dental, and vision benefits for both
the candidate and dependents, 401k plan with company matching, and an
unlimited paid-time-off policy.

**Equal Opportunity**

Altius does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national
origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical
conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age,
status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or
other applicable legally protected characteristics.

## The Company

Miso Robotics is transforming the restaurant industry and making a real impact
on the world.

Miso Robotics is writing an epic new story for the restaurant industry. We've
developed a robotic kitchen assistant, Flippy, that can perform a variety of
kitchen tasks including flipping burgers and running the deep fryer. Our
product is a robotic arm on a rail that fits into existing kitchens along
existing cook lines and is designed to work with existing equipment alongside
kitchen workers. Under the hood, Flippy relies on our platform which combines
deep learning and other computer vision technologies with optimization-based
scheduling and nonlinear control to adapt quickly to a variety of kitchen
workflows, while achieving graceful and efficient motion.

The challenge of bringing robotics into commercial kitchens requires many
disciplines to come together. The compositions of teams at Miso Robotics
reflect this multidisciplinary nature of our work. We have built a world-class
team and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us. If you
believe, like we do, that the future of the kitchen involves robotics and
artificial intelligence (HINT: It definitely does) and if you want to count
yourself among the handful of lucky people who've found themselves with the
opportunity to solve this problem, then Miso Robotics might be the right place
for you!

##  The Role

Assuming the role of ML/Robotics Research Engineer puts you on the cusp of
advanced technology development. You will scout ahead, exploring the latest
ideas and technologies in Robotics, Machine Learning, IoT, Cloud Computing,
and Scalable Architectures. As a member of Research and Advanced Development,
you will interview team members and domain experts to help identify the
biggest opportunities and understand the most significant challenges. You will
regularly create prototype solutions, disseminate learnings through writings
and presentations, and continue to champion adoption as you hand these
prototypes off for production development.

You will work in many different domain areas so you must be able to learn
rapidly. You will collaborate on research partnerships with universities and
attend conferences as necessary to stay up to date on the latest developments.
You will combine broad knowledge in a variety of fields with expertise in
software development to bridge the gap between research and production.

##  What You’ll Do

In this role, you will:

  * Research and develop new theories in robotics and computer vision.
  * Design simulations to validate vision and control strategies.
  * Build and maintain tools to improve development efficiency.
  * Review approaches, algorithms, and architectural diagrams and provide helpful feedback.
  * Take on problems and research the solution space to find several reasonable solutions.
  * Create high-quality rapid prototypes to demonstrate new concepts and technologies.
  * Create unit tests and system-level tests to verify code functionality.
  * Create diagrams and documentation to communicate to a wide audience of developers.
  * Create documentation to help identify and clarify functional requirements.
  * Develop a strong systems-level understanding of our products.
  * Performs other related duties as assigned.

##  What You Need in Order to Succeed in this Role

#####  Technical Requirements

  * Bachelor’s Degree in Robotics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
  * 3+ years experience in developing software in Python.
  * 3+ years experience with ROS (Robot Operating System).
  * 3+ years experience with ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
  * Experience solving controls problems with multi-DoF robots.
  * Experience solving robotics vision problems with machine learning.
  * Strong working knowledge of Linux, Git, and Docker.
  * Experience working with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS or Azure.

Other Requirements

  * Superb oral and written communication skills.
  * Ability to collaborate effectively with a team.
  * Ability to adapt your coding style to our internal style.
  * Willingness and eagerness to share your opinions on problems and solutions.
  * Proclivity for staying up to date with best practices.
  * Great at managing multiple tasks and getting stuff done in a fast-paced environment.
  * Strong attention to detail, analytical skills and ability to learn at hyperspeed.
  * Obsession with clarity.
  * Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

##  Benefits and Perks

  * Unlimited PTO policy
  * Comprehensive benefits offerings
  * 401K plan
  * Education reimbursement program
  * Competitive pay
  * Advancement opportunities

Job summary  
Excited about robotics, and how they will be used in our everyday lives? The
Amazon Consumer Robotics group is pushing the boundaries of what’s possible,
making the future closer than ever.  
  
Astro is Amazon’s first household robot to gracefully and intuitively interact
with people and spaces. It is a different kind of robot, one that’s designed
to help customers with a range of tasks like home monitoring and keeping in
touch with family. It brings together new advancements in artificial
intelligence, computer vision, sensor and motor technology, voice and edge
computing in a package that’s designed to be helpful and convenient.  
  
The Role  
As a Robotics and Controls Engineer you will be responsible for developing
solutions to control electro-mechanical systems. You will take responsibility
for developing models, performing analysis, producing and prototyping
algorithms for the control and estimation of robotic systems that guide and
inform mechanical and electrical designs, and software implementation. You
will demonstrate cross-functional resource interaction to accomplish your
goals. You will play a role in defining processes and methods to improve the
productivity of the entire team. You will investigate applicable academic and
industry research applications, identify and initiate investigations of
production technologies, prototype and test solutions to support product
features, and design and help validate production designs that deliver an
exceptional user experience.  
  
You will demonstrate strong analytical and working knowledge of physical
systems, the desire to learn from new challenges and the problem solving and
communication skills to work within a highly interactive and experienced team.
Candidates must show a hands-on passion for their work and be able to
communicate their ideas and concepts both verbally and visually. Candidates
must demonstrate an ability to integrate feedback and to respond quickly to
changing contexts and work environments. In this role, you will:  
  

  * Develop and prototype controls and estimation algorithms for robotic systems
  * Develop tests, perform failure analysis, and solution validation for product development
  * Conduct field failure analysis and solution evaluation for production product issues
  * Support positive team interactions to accomplish program objectives
  * Provide cross-functional program integration support to ensure team success
  * Commit to timely delivery of product features
  * Manage schedules and milestones
  * Apply technical expertise to problem solving throughout product lifecycle
  * Mentor junior engineers in good practice
  * PhD degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace or related field
  * Experience with motor control and firmware development
  * Deep understanding of the first principles to guide electro-mechanical system modeling
  * Deep understanding of state estimation methodologies using classical observers, Kalman Filter, etc.
  * Experience in designing controllers using Model Predictive Control, Optimal Control and Adaptive Control theory
  * Demonstrated influence in selection of sensors, actuators and electro-mechanical design
  * Demonstrated experience implementing controls in production systems
  * Demonstrated examples of implemented controls in high volume or consumer systems
  * Demonstrated leadership and mentoring skills
  * Experience with 3D CAD such as Solidworks, Creo or equivalent

Job Title: Autonomous Driving - Staff Robotics Engineer - Planning – XC
Job Description:
Company Description

  
At Bosch, “Invented for Life” is what drives us and our vision of global
future mobility. Bosch has an outstanding track record on pioneering key
technologies worldwide which continuously shapes the way we move. The next big
milestone in our sight is to make autonomous vehicles a reality, bringing its
benefits to today's roads.

We are a growing team looking for technology leaders who want to make their
mark by solving some of the hardest challenges in robotics and artificial
intelligence.

If you want to take autonomous vehicles not only one step further but all the
way then we would like to hear from you.

  

Job Description

  
In particular we are looking for an experienced staff robotics engineer for
our Behavior Planner team, with outstanding expertise in search based
planning, probabilistic robotics and proven software engineering skills.

As a staff robotics engineer you will be responsible for a team of planning
experts and the components overall maturity (functional performance & SW-
Quality).

The behavior planner is the component of our system which is responsible for
tactical decision making and interacts closely with the trajectory planner and
prediction module.

All high-level decisions on how to engage with the surrounding traffic
environment (stop, follow, handling traffic lights, yield, change lanes,…) are
computed by the behavioral planner.

 **Responsibilities include:**

  * Foster and further grow the Planning Team.
    * Support professional development of team.
    * Actively grow team competence by improving technical skills (mentoring).
  * Design, develop, implement and evaluate next-generation algorithms for:
    * Planning under uncertainty, probabilistic approaches in robotics, and novel ways for risk-aware intelligent decision making in uncertain environments.

  * Align the overall planning component vision and roadmap by shaping technical discussion with other teams and creating consensus.
  * Deliver reliable software through code reviews, continuous integration and automated testing.

  * Analyze performance based on simulation and real-world testing.
  * Work with leadership team on shaping the way to our final product release.

  

Qualifications  

  * Strong Expertise in planning under uncertainty and novel ways for risk-aware intelligent decision making in uncertain environments.
  * Working experience in the field of automated driving.
  * Strong background in probabilistic robotics.
  * Excellent communication skills.
  * Strong background in writing algorithms in C++ efficiently and correctly in a production environment (code reviews, unit tests, …).
  * Knowledge of Linux, and development on Linux systems.
  * Proven system integration and software architecture skills.
  * Bachelor of Science in Robotics/Computer Science (or related field) .
    * Bachelor of Science plus 10+ years of industry experience
    * Master of Science plus 7+ years of industry experience
    * PhD plus 5+ years of industry experience

 **Preferred Qualifications**

  * PhD in relevant field of probabilistic robotics plus 5+ years of industry experience
  * Experience with physically realistic simulations (timing frameworks, physical modeling and validation, hardware-in-the-loop).
  * Strong expertise in code optimization.

  
Additional Information

  
By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected
Veteran/Disabled.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering &
Mathematics) Initiatives

  * FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)
  * AWIM (A World in Motion)

Company Description

  
We are a stealth mode startup in the greater Boston area developing eVTOL
passenger vehicles with a novel Propulsion/Guidance Platform for deployment in
the burgeoning Urban Air Mobility Space.

We are looking for a fulltime Mechatronics or Robotics Engineer with a
specialization in motion control / robotic systems design and integration.

Qualifications

 **Bonus Experience**

Additional Information

  
Our innovative startup seeks driven, high performance, high energy independent
achievers who can work on a multidisciplinary team to build a groundbreaking
electric VTOL platform that will be the foundation for a range of high
performance ultra quiet Vertical Flight Systems.

Do you want to work with a fast-growing technology startup focused on
increasing efficiency in agriculture? Do you want to work with robots and the
latest in computer vision and machine learning tech on a daily basis?  
  
Headquartered in Seattle, we are seeking an energetic, hands-on, team-oriented
and responsible individual to fill a full-time Robotics Engineer position as
part of our Robotics team. In this role, you will be working with all aspects
of iUNU robotic projects across the full product development life cycle,
including planning, design, development, testing, field deployment, and fleet
monitoring. This position requires an understanding of how to architect a
robotic system based on mechanical, electrical, software, controls, and non-

theoretical design into a robust, functional, physical product.  
  
Candidates should be familiar with industry standards of designing and

devices, with an emphasis on the use of embedded microcontrollers, single-
board computers, NVIDIA edge devices, and other mobile computing platforms to
orchestrate autonomous data capture. Additionally, ideal candidates will have
an in-depth understanding of designing robust and safety-critical systems
autonomous systems in harsh environments.  
  
iUNU’s core values revolve around grit, innovation, and doing the right thing.
iUNU’s flat organizational structure lends itself to the person willing to
speak their mind and challenge the status quo in order to fulfill the ultimate
mission of delivering the best possible solutions to our grower customers.  
  
About You  
  
You are excited to work with us to create a more profitable, more productive,
and safer agricultural supply chain. You embrace learning and feedback and
feel comfortable in a respectful, open environment. You have the ability to
put together solid robotics systems and see them through to physical
assemblies. You take ownership and responsibility for your projects and are
able to work with others to create solutions for difficult problems.  
  
You continually work on learning and improving your mechanical engineer skill
set in a robotics environment. You're looking for a place where you can learn
from talented mentors and at the same time make significant contributions to
the team and overall organization. You're able to take initiative in a startup
environment where challenges are common and clarity of communication is
critical.  
  
Responsibilities  
  

  * Designing and implementing robotic software stacks on both embedded micro-controllers and single-board Linux computers
  * Designing and implementing real-time motion control systems for robotic scanners
  * Working collaboratively with other robotics, mechanical, and computer vision engineers to drive proper outcomes of LUNA robotics system as a whole
  * Research, develop, and integrate the latest sensor technology into LUNA robots
  * Program high-level robotics tasks with ROS in C++ and Python, and additionally work with real-time operating systems on an embedded micro-controller level

Design and implement large-scale fleet management frameworks across all LUNA
customers  

  * Contribute, maintain, and improve upon autonomous robot operation
  * Work in an Agile SCRUM environment with other members of the robotics team

Qualifications  

  * Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Robotics, or related technical field with typically a minimum of 3 years of related experience
  * Solid understanding and application of principles, concepts, theories, and techniques in robotic systems
  * Experience converting non-technical inputs into hard product requirements and finally into the right solution for the customer
  * Ability to quickly turn a finalized design into a physical prototype by producing engineering drawings, sourcing suppliers, working through procurement challenges, and leading final assembly on compressed timelines
  * Ability to write clear and comprehensive technical documentation
  * Leadership skills
  * Detail-oriented with excellent critical thinking, communication, and time management skills
  * Data-driven problem-solving skills to troubleshoot, triage, and fix mechanical, electrical, and software issues within production, design, and manufacturing of robotic systems

Preferred  

  * Experience with STM32 series micro-controllers
  * Experience with FreeRTOS
  * Deep math and statistics background
  * Inverse kinematics experience
  * Experience with sensor fusion methods (ie. Kalman or particle filtering)
  * Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, Robotics, or related technical field
  * Prior robotics hardware implementation experience
  * Experience with industrial design, DFA, DFM
  * Hands-on experience with additive manufacturing practices and operating associated hardware
  * Experience working within an early/growth-stage startup team
  * Ability to read an electrical schematic or PCB layout
  * Basic experience with Python, C++ and Linux environments using command-line interfaces
  * Experience in low- to medium-volume manufacturing environments involving large products
  * Six Sigma training / certification
  * Experience designing and analyzing parts and assemblies in an industry CAD package (preferably SolidWorks)

Benefits  

  * Competitive salary + equity
  * Unlimited PTO
  * Medical/dental/vision
  * 401k

At iUNU, we’re committed to providing a safe and inclusive environment. We are

This robotics subject matter expert position earns a **competitive salary** of

 **

Figure Engineering is a trusted cross-functional, problem-solving company

Following along with our company's "mind to market" process, you get to lend a

**About Ample:**

Ample is an ambitious startup that is changing the way energy is delivered
into vehicles. The goal of our innovation is to make it easier for a much
wider range of users to own and operate an electric car. By weaving together
smart battery technology, robotics, and a better designed car-battery
interface, we are creating an Electric Vehicle (EV) infrastructure that is
fast, cheap, and generic across automotive manufacturers.

As a member of our team, you will help solve very complex challenges involving
electric vehicles, robotics and smart battery technology, by combining
creative tech design with fast iteration. The Ample team is small, intense,
highly capable and eager to have like-minded individuals to join our team. If
the technology doesn't exist, we're not afraid to invent it, while always
keeping in mind it must be designed for reliability, affordability and easy
deployment.

  

**In this new position, you will:**

  * Be hands-on to tackle and solve an array of practical electro-mechanical technical problems.
  * Implement cloud and client-side applications to coordinate the motion between multiple moving systems.
  * Create predictable movement patterns for robot-robot interactions.
  * Write thorough test procedures and tooling for validating production systems.
  * Communicate across mechanical, electrical, and software domains to investigate and understand underlying design decisions.

  

**Specific Requirements**

**Strong expertise in at least one of the following areas :**

  * Understanding of sensor selection and data acquisition of LIDAR, Radar or Camera-based sensors and their usage in Object Detection, Classification, and Pose Estimation applications of a physical motion system.
  * Design and execution of navigation and controls for multi-axis motion systems.
  * Analysis and guidance of actuator loads, sizing and calibration. Understanding motor controller software interfaces and understanding of electromechanical interfaces.

  

**General Requirements**

  * Ability to take an abstract problem and break it down into an implementable system - starting with a scrappy approach and progressively building it up into a sophisticated solution.
  * Comfortable with debug, testing and verification at multiple levels of software development and system integration.
  * Thorough understanding of electromechanical and communication interfaces.
  * Comfortable with C++ software development.
  * Operational usage of source control and build tools such as Git and CMake
  * Minimum 2 years of industry experience in directly-related areas

AutoX is the front runner of Level 4 driverless RoboTaxis. Our mission is to
democratize autonomy and empower the world with AI drivers to accelerate the
advent of fully driverless cars.. AutoX was founded in 2016 by Dr. Jianxiong
Xiao (a.k.a. Professor X), a world class self-driving technologist from MIT
and Princeton University. Our self-driving platform is known to be capable of
handling the most challenging and dynamic traffic scenarios in urban cities
around the world. AutoX is the first and only company in China - second in the

China's first fully driverless RoboTaxi service that is open to the public.
Global strategic partners include FCA, Honda China, and more. If you love
solving the most rewarding engineering challenge, and exploring the most
