At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally
invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent
technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to
foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For
more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the
world to help solve some of healthcare’s hardest challenges and advance what

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse
backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster
an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect.We
lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team
members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy
to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think
in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of

##  **Job Description**

 **Job Description:**

Software engineers at Intuitive Surgical strive to create the safest and
highest quality robotic system for minimally invasive surgery through the
development of highly reliable software as well as rigorous and robust
technical analysis. This software engineer position is responsible for
microcontroller software development and the design and analysis of algorithms
required to control surgical instruments.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

  * Design, develop, and test microcontroller software used on next generation surgical instruments. Producing high-quality software will involve:

o Working closely with electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, and systems
analyst to understand and document software requirements

o Understanding and designing SW interfaces for fast and robust communication
to ensure safety of mission critical data

o Writing the software needed to implement the necessary requirements

o Developing and executing test protocols to prove the software works reliably

  * Collaborate with the manufacturing team to develop automated procedures and fixtures for programing microcontrollers as well as calibrating, testing, and aiding assembly of instruments.
  * Implement features and algorithms to support new instruments, such as extending a cutter, or making decisions based on data from a new sensor.
  * Perform risk analysis and implement safety algorithms. This includes documenting risks, mitigations, and tests needed to support request for approval by regulatory agencies such as the FDA.
  * Lead by having a breadth of technical knowledge that enables a top-level view of the entire project. Using this perspective, you will act as an interface between the various technical specialties. You are expected to take ownership of issues that cross disciplinary boundaries and use your broad skillset to ensure the success of the project.

##  **Qualifications**

 **Skill/Job Requirements:**

  * MS (preferred) or BS in computer science, electrical engineering, or mechanical engineering with a focus on robotics or electro-mechanics.
  * Experience developing complete software solutions for embedded systems using C/C++.
  * Working knowledge of peripherals commonly used on embedded systems such as ADCs, DACs, PWM and serial communications (I2C, SPI, RS232)
  * Proven experience using electronic bench equipment such as oscilloscopes and function generators for the bring up and troubleshooting of hardware.
  * Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools and effective peer review techniques.
  * Knowledge of Matlab and/or Python.
  * Demonstrate intuitive understanding of mechanical phenomena with ability to do rigorous analysis.
  * Knowledge of servo control systems is a plus.
  * Knowledge of statistics is a plus.
  * Knowledge of Verilog is a plus.
  * Demonstrate excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  * Have the ability to work independently and the determination to solve challenging problems.

##  **Additional Information**

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination
against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Job Title: Embedded Controls Software Engineer - Multiple Levels
Job Description:
## **Summary**

Posted: Apr 28, 2021

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200243345**

Come develop innovative control firmware for autonomous systems. The position
requires high level thinking to architect code solutions along with low-level
programming, excellent communication and leadership skills, and the ability to
work in a fast-paced environment. You will be a mentor to the junior members
of the team and will have the opportunity to lead cross-functional design with
mechanical, electrical, and controls engineers. Working on this technology you
will have the opportunity to have a major impact on the capability, user
experience, and quality of Apple's future products. Our collaborative
environment fosters innovation within a creative solution space.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * The ideal candidate will have at least 5+ years of real time embedded software development experience (design and implementation)
  * Outstanding proficiency in C on resource-constrained embedded platforms
  * Experience with Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS)
  * Working knowledge of standard hardware protocols (e.g. I2C, SPI, UART)
  * Experience with networking, concurrency, and distributed systems
  * Proficiency reading hardware specifications and schematics
  * Knowledge of operating systems concepts.
  * Proficiency debugging embedded software systems: familiarity with JTAG, oscilloscopes, etc.
  * Experience in motor controls and robotic actuators is beneficial
  * Experience with robust coding standards in safety-critical environments such as DO-178B/C, MISRA / ISO 26262, or IEC 61508 / 62304 are a plus
  * Experience with model-driven architecture and formal verification is desirable

## **Description**

In this role, you will design and implement control systems firmware for the
complex embedded systems that form the backbone of groundbreaking Apple
products. Working in a vibrant, collaborative environment, you will design,
implement, and integrate software for some of the most sophisticated
technologies on the planet. This position is ideal for candidates with a broad
engineering background, a passion for problem solving, and specific expertise
in firmware development. Backgrounds in multidisciplinary fields such as
consumer devices, medical devices, robotics, mechatronics, aerospace, and the
like would all be excellent preparation for the highly cross-functional
environment at Apple.

## **Education & Experience**

Bachelor of Science degree in one of CS, CE, EE plus five years in industry,
Masters plus three years, or equivalent experience.

## **Additional Requirements**

The Laser and Sensor Test Engineer applies the highest level of skill and
knowledge of laser optics, imaging, metrology, and optical-/electrical-based
sensors (health, motion, magnetic, environmental) in architecting
test/calibration stations for consumer electronics devices on a subassembly
and system level. You will drive conceptual test system hardware design with
technology groups in the early product exploration stage and validate first
article design in the lab. You will lead the end-to-end development of
software and hardware integration, including test flow, instrument control,
robotics/motion control, data capture and process, and integration of advanced
algorithms with third-party partners. You will be an optical or electrical
engineer expert for the team for consultation and also to design quick
prototypes to aid test station validation. You will be leading in documenting
and troubleshooting station hardware/software issues on test equipment and
systems and bridge to production. The ideal candidate is a self-driven
individual working in a cross-functional team environment and will be
responsible for planning the design, development, and implementation of
factory test/calibration systems. You will enforce manufacturability,
testability and ensure cost-effective designs are implemented for testing and
automation systems, software, and equipment. This position will have
responsibilities for NTI (New Technology Introduction) and NPI test
development and bridge to sustaining support of production. You must be
responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer
environment. We are looking for someone with a productive mindset who can
apply their expertise to solve problems in creative, insightful ways.  
  
  

### **Laser and Sensor Test Engineer Responsibilities:**  

  * Develop and deploy advanced manufacturing-ready laser and sensor test stations for Meta AR/VR consumer electronics products.
  * Coordinates third-party vendors in designing, fabricating and developing test systems.
  * Develop and deploy end-to-end test software including test sequence, motion stage/robotics control, image capturing/processing and data transaction interface to defined IT infrastructure.
  * Drive third-party vendors to develop and customize instruments (including camera, lens, sensor, light source, etc.) that meet the unique requirements of test systems.
  * Analyze, evaluate, design, integrate and test the first article fixture to meet specification and proof of concept.
  * Lead functional technology groups and drive cross-functional decisions on test development and architecture.
  * Validation of test SW/FW releases, including repeatability and negative testing, and coordinate SW upgrades with fixture integrator and CM/JDM partners.
  * Troubleshoot and debug test systems and automation solutions from a software and hardware perspective in full autonomy.
  * Support failure analysis on systems and use data to improve test strategies and processes.
  * Serve as subject matter expert for the test team for sensitive electrical and/or laser measurements.
  * Work with vendors and firmware/electrical design team to design prototype or driver boards (e.g. for camera or sensors) and FPCs for rapid prototypes.
  * Travel up to 25%, includes domestics and International travels for prototype builds support, mass production sustaining, and collaboration with R&D teams.

  
  
  

### **Minimum Qualifications:**  

  * Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Optics or related field.
  * 2+ years of experience in developing test/calibration solutions in a consumer electronics or related field.
  * 2+ years of experience in at least one of the two areas: Optical metrology (spectrometer, radiometer, imaging optics, color sensor, etc.) or High-precision sensitive electrical signal measurements, including noise shielding and suppression.
  * Experience with designing complicated test systems integrating instruments, mechanical motion, electrical controls, and test software.
  * Experience with programming languages such as Python, C/C++, and data processing tools such as MATLAB, JMP and Minitab.
  * Experience in statistical methods (distributions, SPC, Cpk, etc.) for data analytics.

  
  
  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**  

  * Master/Ph.D. in Physics, Electrical Engineering, or Optics.
  * Experience with laser safety classification and the required tests.
  * Experience with health sensors (e.g. heart rate, oximeter), electrical-based sensors (e.g. electromyography), optical-based sensors (e.g. ambient light), or environmental sensors (e.g. magnetometer, proximity).
  * Experience with standard communication buses (I2C, SPI, UART, etc.).
  * Software skills: Python proficiency, image processing algorithms.
  * 5+ years experience with factory tests for consumer electronics products for NPI and mass production.
  * Experience with managing multiple third-party vendors from evaluation, down-selection, and driving deliverables to meet project requirements.

* 9 Month contract opportunity
  * Compensation: $85 - $100/hr
  * Worksite: 3420 Central Expressway, Santa Clara, CA

  
We’re Intuitive: a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and a
pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery. Working closely with hospital teams,
we’re developing integrated solutions that help enable physicians to get
patients back to what matters most. Our technology has been used in nearly 10
million operations across 67 countries.

Together, we’ve dedicated more than two decades for innovating for better care
through enhanced experiences, improved efficiencies, and reduced cost of care.
In this role, you will join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a
global community of healthcare professionals and their patients.

 **  
Primary Function of Position:**

The Design Controls Engineer plays a vital role in developing safe and
effective medical devices at Intuitive Surgical. As an embedded member of the
New Product Development (R&D) team, they support the rapid and efficient
development of new products, while ensuring that complete and transparent
records of product designs are created and maintained. They work closely with
a team of exceptionally talented engineers and design professionals developing
highly innovative products for use in the operating room. Their work helps
safeguard the integrity of the design and ensures that Design History Files
(DHF’s) meet all regulatory requirements.  

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

  * Assist the new product development team with compiling and updating of engineering design control documents for Design History Files, including risk analyses, requirements, trace reports, and design verification and validation test documentation for the Single Port system.
  * Assist the cross functional new product development team with architecting a holistic documentation/tracing structure that is easily maintained.
  * Support design team to produce high quality, consistent design documents that meet Intuitive Surgical’s design control processes.
  * Use the requirements management database tool extensively to manage design control documents, and the links between document content.
  * Assist subject matter experts with writing, reviewing, and/or editing documents required by Intuitive Surgical’s design control process, including requirements, risk analyses, specifications, test protocols, and design review checklists.
  * Coordinate documentation and Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) related to major design reviews.
  * Produce requirements trace mapping and associated documentation.
  * Use PTC Integrity and/or Siemens Polarion as a tool to accomplish the following:
  * Enter and edit documents.
  * Create and edit requirements and test cases.
  * Create trace links
  * Produce reports using standard report templates. Create additional custom reports as needed.
  * Produce trace reports.
  * Use Agile as a tool to accomplish the following:
  * Organize and structure Design History Files (DHF) using Design Control checklists.
  * Prepare and submit ECOs for individual documents and for DHF Bill of Material (BOM) changes.
  * Work with the Technical Publications department to assure that Manuals, Instructions for Use, Labels and Training Materials are consistent with design documentation. Create trace documents and protocols used to assist in this process.

 **  
Skills, Experience, Education, & Training:**

  * Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or other technical area
  * Ability to understand complex technical information and translate into writing
  * Experience writing and reviewing engineering (design control) documents, including specifications, test protocols and test reports
  * Proven success recognizing critical issues with the ability to react quickly under pressure, and drive issues to closure by providing coordinated direction.
  * Ability to manage challenging assignments and multiple assignments in parallel
  * Strong planning, decision making, negotiating and change management skills
  * Assertive, outgoing personality with an ability to work collaboratively within an engineering team
  * Excellent writing and communication skills, and attention to detail
  * Skilled in the use of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, and Adobe Acrobat

 **  
Preferred:**

  * Experience working in an ISO 9001 medical device product development environment or other regulated industry
  * Experience writing and reviewing engineering (design control) documents, including specifications, test protocols and test reports
  * Skilled in the use of Agile or similar lifecycle management system tool
  * Skilled in the use of Integrity, Polarion or other requirements management tool
  * Development experience with complex systems with a combination of hardware and software
  * Experience in Risk Analysis and Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEAs)
  * Experience with EU MDR implementation

  
Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Intuitive
through our direct sourcing partner, Raise Recruiting, who manages Intuitive’s
Contractor Talent Community. If you are selected for this role, you will be
employed by Raise and will not be an employee of Intuitive.

## **Summary**

Posted: Apr 6, 2022

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200340424**

Are you a fearless thinker? Do you love the challenge of advancing a widely
accepted technology? In the Wireless Software group, you’ll be responsible for
bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world through Wi-Fi,
Bluetooth, GPS, and more. You’ll design, develop, and patent the next
generation of our state-of-the art connectivity technologies. You’ll
collaborate across departments to help craft wireless solutions that elevate
the customer experience with Apple products and services. Our goal is to
ensure nothing stands in the way of our customers’ connections with their
devices. If you join us, you’ll help build world-renowned wireless systems so
seamless that they almost feel like magic. Join our Wireless Technology
Ecosystem (WTE) and drive innovation that matters! We build and seamlessly
integrate technologies that enrich people’s lives and deliver the best user-
experience. The NFC, eSIM, SE, Telephony team is looking for motivated, highly
technical engineer with excellent problem solving and coding skills. You will
be part of the NFC/Applets Engineering team responsible for automation and
testing of Interoperability (IOT) for NFC use cases such as ApplePay, Transit
and Access.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * Proven experience in using Python/C/C++ and/or Java.
  * Experience in crafting, writing, and automating test cases for specific features and creating automation tools/frameworks.
  * You are experienced with SQA methodologies & practices and proficient with filing bug reports.
  * You understand Git and other system softwares.
  * Preferred experience and knowledge of ISO14443 application layer and/or NFC Forum/EMV standards/Global Platform and/or Java Card is a plus!
  * Preferred experience with Robotics a plus!
  * Experience with wireless communication technologies is a plus.
  * You thrive in a reciprocal environment and can clearly communicate while driving multiple projects across many teams.
  * You are enthusiastically passionate and inquisitive, and seek to tackle everyday problems in innovative ways.
  * You are laser-focused on the smallest details that are significant to our customers.
  * Results oriented and excellent debugging skills.
  * Excellent writing and communication skills.
  * In-depth understanding of OS X, Windows and/or Unix.

## **Description**

You will join a team with varied strengths responsible for qualifying NFC Use
Cases on Apple's innovative devices. As a part of this team, you will be
responsible for qualifying and automating Interoperability testing for NFC Use
cases on Apple devices, reporting test results and filing quality bug reports.
You will also be engaged in driving terminal vendors for successful launch of
projects and integration of terminals into a robotics automation framework.
The ideal engineer for this role is comfortable working in a cross functional,
multifaceted and creative team charged with exploring an uncharted and
constantly evolving domain. You will take an active role in crafting the
quality of innovative applications using emerging new technologies. You will
be deeply coordinated with our development engineers, developing test plans,
automating tests, and supporting design reviews and collaborating with cross
functional teams to drive projects.

## **Education & Experience**

Bachelors or higher degree in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering

## **Additional Requirements**

  * You should possess the ability to quickly grasp & distill highly complex matters into clean, understandable solutions, delivering clearly documented test plans. The applicant will be an effective diplomat with strong communication & organizational skills. To succeed here, you'll need above all to be passionate about shipping a NFC experience that is the best of its kind.

An Aerospace client is looking for a **Mission Space Engineer** to support new
mission concept formulations as a space telecommunications subject matter
expert, including concurrent engineering, rapid mission formulation Team X.

  

  
**Location** : Pasadena, CA 91109  
**Position** : Mission Space Engineer  
**Duration** : 12 months  
**Pay rate:** $51.35 – 78.20/hr. DOE (depending on experience)  
**Flexible work schedule** : 9/80 or 5/40

**We do offer paid time offs, holidays, 401k, medical, dental, and vision**

  

  
**Position Summary** :

**Responsibilities** :

  * Will design high-level telecom subsystems to meet mission requirements including total downlink data volume, radiometric navigation, and command uplinks
  * Will calculate telecom link margins using a statistically derived design control table and manage and track changes to reduce uncertainties
  * Will perform analyses to support trade studies such as telecom hardware selection (e.g. radios, antenna types), frequency band selection, modulation and coding selection, etc.
  * Will generate subsystem, box, and module-level requirements with full requirements traceability and flow-down using requirements management systems such as DOORS.
  * Will negotiate interface agreements with other subsystem elements and partner interfaces; document agreed requirements as interface requirements and control documents
  * Will manage requirement changes through Engineering Change Requests (ECR) with Change Control Board (CCB) concurrence and approvals
  * Will evaluate compliance against JPL Design Principles (DP) and Flight Project Practices (FPP)
  * Will assist in the preparation of verification and validation (V&V) plans.
  * Will support the design of RF & digital hardware, software, and firmware for radio and digital processor developments.
  * Will plan and help execute ambient and environmental test campaigns for prototype, engineering model, and flight model radio technologies.
  * Will track and document mass, power and data volume specifications and budgets for telecom components and subsystem.
  * Will support Hardware Review/Certification Requirements (HRCR) and Certificate of Flight Readiness (CoFR) reviews for flight deliveries.
  * Will support the product manager in managing risks, performance error budgets, trade studies, design integration, and maintaining delivery schedules.

  

**Required Skills** :

  * Bachelor’s degree in engineering, physical sciences, or mathematics with a minimum of 6 years of professional experience, or Master’s degree with 4 years of experience, or Ph.D with 2 years of experience.
  * Demonstrated skills in designing, implementing, and testing electronic hardware or instruments that are used within complex space systems.
  * Experience within a multidisciplinary system engineering or test team
  * Demonstrated knowledge of processes that are used to verify/validate the design requirements of systems.
  * Experience in testing of systems, including test planning, test procedure development, and data analysis.
  * Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
  * Ability to collaborate successfully with other groups, sections, divisions, and organizations, both inside and outside JPL.
  * Experience with development of formal procedures and documentation relating to space flight hardware
  * Ability to react to frequent changes in plans and excel in a rapid pace concurrent engineering environment.
  * Understanding of the proper application of JPL design principles, flight project practices, hardware-handling constraints, and the JPL risk management practices.
  * Wide-ranging experience and knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Spacecraft Telecom Systems Engineering, Software Defined Radios Design Principles, RF Design, Digital & Analog Hardware Design, Embedded Software and Firmware, and Digital & RF Ground Support Equipment.
  * Hands-on experience in the development and test of both telecom systems and embedded digital hardware, as well demonstrated ability to understand and debug/troubleshoot complex systems

  

**Desired Skills** :

  * Knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.
  * Some understanding and application experience with all aspects of spacecraft telecom systems engineering for earth orbiting missions including telecom architecture, design, link budgets, spacecraft interfaces for high-speed data and low speed telemetry, EMI issues and mitigation, spectrum planning, ground station use planning.
  * Experience with development, documentation and execution of radio system tests, including formal validation and verification tracking for fulfillment of requirements.
  * Experience with designing Software Defined Radios (SDR)
  * Understanding and application of advanced principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in Modulation and Coding, RF hardware including antenna and front-end hardware, link design and modeling, networking hardware and protocols, RF hardware testing and test automation.
  * Knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to Digital Signal Processing, Digital Filter Design, Digital Modem Design, Equalization, signal tracking loops, demodulation processes, channel coding/decoding.
  * Proficiency with a range of tools for numerical analysis, electronic design, firmware, embedded software, and/or testing automation.
  * Direct experience with flight telecom component development and delivery.
  * Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, including the ability to interact with project, program, and line management and the engineering team.

  

  
At a minimum, a 7-year background check, education verification, employment
verification, and drug screen will be conducted upon hire. Your suitability
for employment is contingent upon successfully passing these required pre-
employment screenings.

Ability to multitask, and handle tasks with competing priorities effectively. Ability to work with biological samples, including blood, tissue, and organs.

### **About RIOS**

RIOS Intelligent Machines, Inc. ("RIOS") is a technology company helping
enterprises automate their entire factories, warehouses, or supply chain
operations – by deploying AI-powered end-to-end robotic workcells that
integrate within existing workflows. RIOS is the leader of fullstack AI-
powered robotic workcells for factory automation and deploys its robotic fleet
at scale to transform labor-intensive factories into "lights-out" factories of
the future powered by robotics and AI. RIOS was founded by former Xerox PARC
engineers and is headquartered in Menlo Park, CA. More information is
available at www.rios.ai.

RIOS is looking for an Robotics Controls Development Engineer that can own the
application logic and related robotics controls pipeline development for
various customer use cases. This typically will include leveraging existing
pipeline tools in different ways, along with a degree of custom development,
to meet customer KPI's.

  * Work daily on multiple robot platforms with custom hardware and software stacks

  * Experience with real-time operating system
  * Actively practice the Git-based CI/CD workflow

Job summary  
Excited about robotics, and how they will be used in our everyday lives? The
Amazon Consumer Robotics group is pushing the boundaries of what’s possible,
making the future closer than ever.  
  
Astro is Amazon’s first household robot to gracefully and intuitively interact

touch with family. It brings together new advancements in artificial
intelligence, computer vision, sensor and motor technology, voice and edge
computing in a package that’s designed to be helpful and convenient.  
  
The Role  
As a Robotics and Controls Engineer you will be responsible for developing
solutions to control electro-mechanical systems. You will take responsibility
for developing models, performing analysis, producing and prototyping
algorithms for the control and estimation of robotic systems that guide and
inform mechanical and electrical designs, and software implementation. You
will demonstrate cross-functional resource interaction to accomplish your
goals. You will play a role in defining processes and methods to improve the
productivity of the entire team. You will investigate applicable academic and
industry research applications, identify and initiate investigations of
production technologies, prototype and test solutions to support product
features, and design and help validate production designs that deliver an
exceptional user experience.  
  
You will demonstrate strong analytical and working knowledge of physical
systems, the desire to learn from new challenges and the problem solving and
communication skills to work within a highly interactive and experienced team.
Candidates must show a hands-on passion for their work and be able to
communicate their ideas and concepts both verbally and visually. Candidates
must demonstrate an ability to integrate feedback and to respond quickly to
changing contexts and work environments. In this role, you will:  
  

  * Develop and prototype controls and estimation algorithms for robotic systems
  * Develop tests, perform failure analysis, and solution validation for product development
  * Conduct field failure analysis and solution evaluation for production product issues
  * Support positive team interactions to accomplish program objectives
  * Provide cross-functional program integration support to ensure team success
  * Commit to timely delivery of product features
  * Manage schedules and milestones
  * Apply technical expertise to problem solving throughout product lifecycle
  * Mentor junior engineers in good practice

  * Experience with motor control and firmware development
  * Deep understanding of the first principles to guide electro-mechanical system modeling
  * Deep understanding of state estimation methodologies using classical observers, Kalman Filter, etc.

  * Demonstrated influence in selection of sensors, actuators and electro-mechanical design
  * Demonstrated experience implementing controls in production systems
  * Demonstrated examples of implemented controls in high volume or consumer systems
  * Demonstrated leadership and mentoring skills

**About Oishii:**

At Oishii, we grow the best fruit in the world by deploying ground-breaking
vertical farming technology that pushes the boundaries of agriculture. We're
the first in the world to grow fruit in an indoor vertical farm at commercial
scale. We started with strawberries, which we debuted at Chef's Table at
Brooklyn Fare, the three star Michelin restaurant considered by critics to be
among the best in the world. Since then, we have supplied our strawberries to
food-loving consumers, world-class restaurants, and specialty retailers across
NYC. Our proprietary technology, developed through years of intensive research
in Japan and the US, enables us to grow the very best produce year-round, at
the same high level of quality, all without using any pesticides. We have
rapidly expanded our farm facilities and assembled a world-class team with
backgrounds spanning vertical farming, industrial automation, farm operations,
and data analysis. Oishii has been profiled in Eater, NPR, Time, and Fortune.
If you're interested in building the farm of the future with us, we look
forward to hearing from you!

**About the role:**

We're hiring Robotics Software Engineers (Mid/Senior Levels) to work
collaboratively with our robotics, automation, controls, electrical, and
mechanical vertical farm engineering experts. In this role, you'll be charged
with developing, refining and implementing robotics software roadmaps that
synchronize with our strategic automation plans. You'll work closely with our
CTO, engineering leaders, and technology partners and your work will
accelerate the large scale deployment of fully automated indoor vertical
farming systems.

  * Work closely with company senior management and engineering management to develop and implement software strategy which aligns with company level goals
  * Mange the design of software systems capable of delivering fully automated farm systems at commercial, manufacturing scale
  * Collaborate closely with multiple engineering disciplines in addition to farming and R&D experts
  * Work alongside robotics engineers to prototype, test, iterate and deploy automation systems
  * Manage internal and external stakeholders, ensuring alignment on timelines, goals, budgets, and project level optimizations

**Who you are:**

  * BS or MS in Robotics, Computer Science, or related field
  * Minimum 5 years of professional relevant work experience
  * Proven track record of bringing automation technologies from prototyping to large scale deployment
  * Capable and flexible problem solver able to understand strategic priorities and execute tactically
  * Deep experience with hardware and integration

## The Company

Miso Robotics is transforming the restaurant industry and making a real impact
on the world.

Miso Robotics is writing an epic new story for the restaurant industry. We've
developed a robotic kitchen assistant, Flippy, that can perform a variety of
kitchen tasks including flipping burgers and running the deep fryer. Our
product is a robotic arm on a rail that fits into existing kitchens along
existing cook lines and is designed to work with existing equipment alongside
kitchen workers. Under the hood, Flippy relies on our platform which combines
deep learning and other computer vision technologies with optimization-based
scheduling and nonlinear control to adapt quickly to a variety of kitchen
workflows, while achieving graceful and efficient motion.

The challenge of bringing robotics into commercial kitchens requires many
disciplines to come together. The compositions of teams at Miso Robotics
reflect this multidisciplinary nature of our work. We have built a world-class
team and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us. If you
believe, like we do, that the future of the kitchen involves robotics and
artificial intelligence (HINT: It definitely does) and if you want to count
yourself among the handful of lucky people who've found themselves with the
opportunity to solve this problem, then Miso Robotics might be the right place
for you!

##  The Role

Assuming the role of ML/Robotics Research Engineer puts you on the cusp of
advanced technology development. You will scout ahead, exploring the latest
ideas and technologies in Robotics, Machine Learning, IoT, Cloud Computing,
and Scalable Architectures. As a member of Research and Advanced Development,
you will interview team members and domain experts to help identify the
biggest opportunities and understand the most significant challenges. You will
regularly create prototype solutions, disseminate learnings through writings
and presentations, and continue to champion adoption as you hand these
prototypes off for production development.

You will work in many different domain areas so you must be able to learn
rapidly. You will collaborate on research partnerships with universities and
attend conferences as necessary to stay up to date on the latest developments.
You will combine broad knowledge in a variety of fields with expertise in
software development to bridge the gap between research and production.

##  What You’ll Do

In this role, you will:

  * Research and develop new theories in robotics and computer vision.
  * Design simulations to validate vision and control strategies.
  * Build and maintain tools to improve development efficiency.
  * Review approaches, algorithms, and architectural diagrams and provide helpful feedback.
  * Take on problems and research the solution space to find several reasonable solutions.
  * Create high-quality rapid prototypes to demonstrate new concepts and technologies.
  * Create unit tests and system-level tests to verify code functionality.
  * Create diagrams and documentation to communicate to a wide audience of developers.
  * Create documentation to help identify and clarify functional requirements.
  * Develop a strong systems-level understanding of our products.
  * Performs other related duties as assigned.

  * 3+ years experience with ROS (Robot Operating System).

  * Experience solving controls problems with multi-DoF robots.
  * Experience solving robotics vision problems with machine learning.

Other Requirements

Job summary  
Excited about robotics, and how they will be used in our everyday lives? The
Amazon Consumer Robotics group brings together new advancements in artificial
intelligence, computer vision, sensor and motor technology, voice and edge
computing to push the boundaries of what’s possible.  
  
The Role  
As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will work cross-functionally with other
exceptional engineers to develop robust and efficient firmware solutions. Our
technology team delivers firmware for controlling and interfacing with
Amazon’s latest consumer devices, including consumer robotics. We are looking
for driven software engineers with a passion for working hands-on with
electromechanical systems and turning their ideas into reality to join our
team. Your work will have a direct impact on getting Amazon’s next generation
of products into the hands of millions of customers.  
  
If you have a passion for creating, learning in a dynamic, fast-paced
environment, and writing code that brings hardware to life, come join us and
see what we’re building next!  
  
In this role, you will:  

  * Design, develop, test and deploy firmware for ARM microcontrollers and other embedded systems
  * Apply your experience of designs and approaches to define the right technical solution for the challenging problems of embedded systems
  * Follow industry best practices, participate in design/code reviews and continuously gather feedback to develop robust and maintainable software

  * Experience in communicating with customers, technical, business teams and management to collect requirements, describe product features, and technical designs

Robotics and Digital Solutions, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of
companies, is recruiting for a Staff Robotics & Controls Engineer. This
position is located in Santa Clara, CA.

At Johnson & Johnson Robotics and Digital Solutions, we're changing the
trajectory of health for humanity, using robotics to enhance healthcare
providers’ abilities and improve diagnoses, treatments, and recovery times for
patients. Johnson & Johnson Robotics was established in 2020 with the
integration of Auris Health, Verb Surgical, C-SATS, and Ethicon. It comprises
three key med-tech platforms: Flexible Robotics (MONARCH®), Surgical Robotics
(OTTAVA™) and Digital Solutions. Join our collaborative, rapidly growing teams
based in the San Francisco Bay Area (Redwood City and Santa Clara),
Cincinnati, and Seattle. You'll collaborate on breakthrough medical
technologies that unite multiple subject areas to build a connected digital
ecosystem that advances medical professionals’ skills and improves patient
outcomes.

As a member of R&C SW group you will be developing Control algorithms and
software for the next generation of surgical robots. You will work closely
with the rest of the R&C group and the hardware engineers to develop control
algorithms and software for new surgical instruments, integrate them on the
robot and bring them to life. You will build mathematical models of the
instruments and other subsystems, design controllers for them and evaluate the
performance on robot. You will also build simulation and analysis tools to
inform the requirements. You will gain experience working with some of the
finest minds and problem solvers in an industry that is growing by leaps and
bounds. We encourage Robotics and Controls SW Engineers from outside the med-
tech space, bringing alternative approaches, previous experiences and a fresh
outlook to tackle the outstanding challenges that the med-tech industry is
experiencing. We are looking for a candidate that can work independently,
function well within a team, is flexible, self-motivated, curious and
passionate about revolutionizing the world of medical robotics.

## **Core Job Responsibilities:**

  * Work as part of a focused multi-functional team developing robotic solutions for medical applications
  * Work closely with systems and instrument engineers to implement and test various algorithms
  * Design and implement C++ software in a real-time, safety critical environment
  * Quickly implement concept proofs and prototypes, and test on systems
  * Participate in design discussions and code reviews
  * Create specifications and requirements based on clinical and user inputs.
  * Other related duties as may be assigned.

  
**Qualifications**  

## **Qualifications:**

  * A minimum of a PhD in Robotics, Computer Science, or related fields with 4+ years of experience, OR a Master’s degree with 7+ years of experience developing sophisticated robotics applications for electro-mechanical systems is required.
  * Proven hands-on experience designing and implementing Control SW for sophisticated electromechanical/robotic systems is required
  * Proficient in C/C++ programming with strong debugging skills is required
  * Deep knowledge of linear and nonlinear control, optimization, state and parameter estimation, and time domain and frequency domain analysis is required
  * Familiarity with robot kinematics, dynamics, digital control, and signal processing is preferred
  * Understanding of computer science fundamentals is preferred (e.g. algorithms, data structures, object-oriented design in UNIX environments) is beneficial
  * Familiarity with real-time software is preferred
  * Experience developing safety-critical software is highly desireable
  * Familiarity with an Agile development environment is preferred
  * Ability to work in a regulated environment in compliance to ISO 13485 and 21 CFR 820 is preferred
  * Excellent communication and documentation skills.
  * Ability to travel up to 10%, domestic and international is required

Full time position based in Pasadena, CA

 _  
OffWorld is a robotics startup working on developing a mobile robotic
workforce for heavy industrial jobs on Earth, Moon, asteroids & Mars. OffWorld
was founded by an experienced engineering team drawing on decades of tackling
formidable engineering challenges at NASA, ESA, NOAA, Maxar Technologies,
CERN, Reaction Engines, SAFRAN, Surrey Satellites and Cisco. OffWorld’s first
challenge is developing and maturing a modular robotic system for extreme
environments on Earth. Our robots will go deeper underground and further on
Earth than humans can, eliminating the need for humans to work in life-
threatening environments in mining, construction, tunneling and other
dangerous industries. They will also dramatically reduce the environmental
footprint and cost of operations in key economies on Earth and beyond._

 _We have designed a modular robotic architecture that focuses on maximizing
the commonality and reusability across components for fast deployment and
optimization. Our robotic systems combine sensory information with cutting
edge machine learning (ML) for control and decision making._

OffWorld is seeking a talented and motivated Robotics Embedded Systems
Engineer to join a fast-moving team working to create advanced robot systems.
You will be working on the design of custom electrical designs, circuit
boards, electronic assemblies and firmware for current and future robotic
system designs developed at OffWorld. You will design embedded electronic
systems and develop the firmware to operate electro-mechanical components. You
will see your own designs integrated into real robots. You will have the
opportunity to be part of the complete lifecycle of robot design and be
exposed to many other disciplines including mechanical/electrical integration,
firmware design and end to end system lab and field test.

A successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to work in a team along
with the required communication skills to effectively interact with other
engineers.

  
To hit the ground running, you need:

  * Bachelor or MSc in Electronics Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or equivalent.
  * Practical experience in the design and implementation of end-to-end electronic components and firmware for embedded systems, electro-mechanical equipment, industrial machinery, EVs, drones or robots (past industry position or internship). Controls & data handling systems integration experience is a plus.
  * Experience in embedded system design and component integration
  * Experience in writing firmware development for microcontrollers.
  * Experience with communication protocols (I2C, SPI, UART, CAN, etc.)
  * Experience with electronics debugging and failure analysis.
  * Familiarity with ECAD software: Altium, OrCAD, Eagle, or equivalent.
  * Experience in PCB design (component layout, wiring routing), including schematic capture and PCB layout software such as OrCAD or Altium.
  * Knowledge of PCB routing standards (power lines, differential signals, mixed signals) is a plus.
  * Experience with electronics simulation software such as SPICE is a plus.
  * Experience using lab electrical test equipment (multimeters, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers, etc.)
  * Knowledge of Python, C, C++, Matlab. Assembly experience is a plus.
  * Experience with PLC (ABB, Siemens, Schneider), programming is a plus.
  * Excellent verbal and written/online communication skills.
  * Demonstrated ability working in a team for research and development or production.
  * Demonstrated ability to organize your work to meet deadlines. Comfortable multi-tasking/working on different projects concurrently.
  * Self-driven, passionate, and constantly pursuing knowledge and excellence.
  * Nothing-is-impossible attitude.

Quidel’s mission is to provide patients with immediate and frequent access to
highly accurate, affordable testing for the good of our families, our
communities and the world. We are a leading manufacturer of point of care
diagnostic solutions. Quidel’s comprehensive product portfolio includes tests
for a wide range of infectious diseases, cardiac and autoimmune biomarkers, as
well as a host of products to detect COVID-19. Quidel pioneered the first FDA-
cleared point-of-care test for influenza in 1999 and was the first to market a
rapid SARS-CoV-2 antigen test in the U.S.

Brooks is a leading worldwide provider of automation, vacuum, and
instrumentation solutions for multiple markets including semiconductor
manufacturing, life sciences, and clean energy. We are currently looking for a
software development engineer for equipment control projects. The primary area
of work is Semiconductor equipment. Our projects all involve embedded software
control of robotic and other motion related hardware.

**This position will require some travel to support our existing customer
within the US and/or International.**

  * Gather requirements, write requirement specification and get spec reviewed by team 
  * Interact with Mechanical, Electrical, and Software engineers and understand system 
  * SQA Software

  * Write Python scripts to test to run EFEM/LoadPorts 
  * Unit testing over software emulation 
  * Test software component to overall system 
  * Work with rest of team in debugging system integration problems 
  * Write ATP (acceptance test procedure) 
  * Analyze logs and create python scripts to test command sequence from logs 
  * Working as a bridge between customers and engineering teams 
  * provide technical support and expertise to customers, testing applications, responding to customer feedback, installations 
  * Collaborating across interdisciplinary teams 
  * Travel to customer sites worldwide

 **BS Degree in Software Engineering Computer Science** , or related field, or

communication skills. Previous experience in working with a small team of 6 –
12 engineers. A minimum of **6 months of experience of working knowledge on C#
Programming, robotics and motion control related software**. Systems
experience minimum of 1 year. System trouble shooting experience.

C++**.

Having 2 of the following **EE/ME/SW background and experience**.

Job Description:

  
Systems Analysts (Robotic Algorithms and Control Engineers) at Intuitive
Surgical strive to create the safest and highest quality robotic system for
minimally invasive surgery though rigorous and robust technical analysis. This
Systems Analyst position is responsible for algorithms and controls required
to support the development and production of new instruments for the daVinci
Surgical System. Required skills include knowledge of control systems, robot
kinematics, and a solid understanding of mechanical systems.

  
Key Responsibilities:

  

  * Develop and own the tele-operated motion performance of robotic surgical instruments. Ensuring motion fidelity will involve:  
  

    * working closely with the clinical development team to understand performance requirements
  

    * working closely with the mechanical design team to optimize the mechanism for motion fidelity
  

    * using analysis and experimentation to develop a deep understanding of the behavior and limitations of the instrument mechanism
  

    * modifying and tuning the algorithms to optimize motion fidelity
  
  

  

  
  
  
  

  

  * Implement features and algorithms to support new instruments, such as extending a cutter, or forming staples.

  

  * Perform the risk analysis and implementation of safety algorithms. This includes documentation of risks, requirements, and test protocols in order to support requests for approval by regulatory agencies such as the FDA.

  

  * Collaborate with the manufacturing team to develop automated fixtures for calibrating, testing, and aiding assembly of the instrument. Additionally, determine manufacturing test specifications that will ensure instrument performance.

  

  * Lead by having a breadth of technical knowledge that enables a top-level view of the entire project. Using this perspective, you will act as an interface between the various technical specialties. You are expected to take ownership of issues that cross disciplinary boundaries, and use your broad skillset to ensure the success of the project.

##  **  
Qualifications**

Skill/Job Requirements:  

  
  
  
  

  

  * PhD (preferred) or Minimum MS in robotics-related field.
  

  * Minimum 4 years of experience in a related field preferred.
  

  * Demonstrate intuitive understanding of mechanical phenomena with ability to do rigorous analysis.  

  

  * C/C++ and Matlab programming skills, as well as hardware, software, and mechanism integration skills. Knowledge of Python is a plus.
  

  * Knowledge of classical and modern servo control systems.
  

  * Knowledge of serial-arm robot kinematics.
  

  * Knowledge of statistics is a plus.
  

  * Knowledge of electrical and mechanical design principles and CAD tools is a plus.  

  

  * Demonstrate excellent communication skills both written and verbal.  

  

  * Have the ability to work independently and the determination to solve challenging problems.

NASA JPL is looking for an **Embedded Software Engineer** to work on the next
generation of Deep Space Network (DSN) antenna servo control systems. The
Antenna Servo embedded software engineer will be responsible for designing,
coding, testing, and documenting embedded software for this project.

  

**Location:** Pasadena, CA 91101

**Position:** Embedded Software Engineer

**Pay Rate:** $47.80 to $75.35/hr. DOE (depending on experience)

**Duration:** 12 months or longer

**Flexible work schedule:** 9/80 or 5/40

**We do offer paid time offs, holidays, 401k, medical, dental, and vision**

  

**Responsibilities:**

  * Running on embedded Single Board Computers, the servo software will interface in real-time with the multi-axis antenna drive systems, execute complex control-system algorithms, and provide monitor and control capability to the DSN operations and maintenance crews.
  * The servo embedded software engineer will work closely with the task lead and control system engineer to develop and code hardware interfaces, control systems, graphical user interfaces and other monitor and control capabilities.
  * They will deliver hardware and software in accordance with the established delivery processes and participate in process improvement initiatives, including CI/CD and DevOps methodologies for the software development life cycle.

  

**Requirements:**

  * US Citizen or Green card holder
  * Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related technical discipline with typically a minimum of 6 years of related experience, a Master’s degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 4 years of related experience.
  * Demonstrated extensive knowledge of C programming language with specific experience in designing and coding control system software in an embedded environment.
  * Experience coding and developing on ARM-based Single Board Computers.
  * Experience with Linux operating systems and knowledge of Linux Kernel.
  * Experience with real-time software with multiple hardware and software interfaces.
  * Software engineering skills with strong system debugging and problem-solving skills.
  * Knowledge of embedded hardware.
  * Good verbal and written communication skill for end users issue analysis support.

  

**Desired Skills:**

  * Knowledge of modern software development tools and practices (GitHub, Eclipse, continuous integration, automated software testing, Agile methodology, DevOps, etc.).
  * Knowledge of container and runtime orchestration frameworks (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, Elastic Container Service).
  * Experience developing graphical user interfaces.
  * Experience with Linux Kernel development.
  * Knowledge of JPL Software Development Standard Practices

  

**Compensation & Benefits**  
**Pay Rate** : $47.80 to $75.35/hr. DOE (depending on experience)

Job Title: Senior Robotic Algorithms and Control Engineer
Job Description:
## **Company Description**

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally
invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent
technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to
foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For
more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the
world to help solve some of healthcare’s hardest challenges and advance what
is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse
backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster
an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect.We
lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as
theirmost authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team
members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy
to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think
in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term
growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest
potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of
healthcare professionals and their patients. Together,let’s advance the world
of minimally invasive care.

##  **Job Description**

 **Job Description:**

This position is responsible for control and safety algorithms required to
support new instruments and accessories on the daVinci Surgical System. Skills
required will include robot kinematics, control systems, and a solid
understanding of electro-mechanical systems.

You will be responsible for the teleoperated motion and force fidelity of new
surgical instruments, and integration of new accessories with the robot. This
will involve:

  * Working closely with the clinical development team to understand requirements for instruments and accessories performance
  * Using analysis and experimentation to develop a deep understanding of the behavior and limitations of the mechanism
  * Working closely with the mechanical design team to characterize and optimize the mechanism for performance and safety
  * Modifying and tuning the algorithms that will control the behavior of the mechanism
  * Implementing new feature sets as well as maintaining the existing ones in software
  * You will be responsible for risk analysis, and implementation of safety algorithms. You will be responsible for documentation of risks, requirements, and test protocols in order to support requests for approval by regulatory agencies such as the FDA.
  * You will be responsible for working with the manufacturing team to develop automated fixtures for calibrating, testing, and aiding assembly of the instrument. You will be responsible for setting manufacturing test specifications that will ensure mechanical performance.
  * You are expected to have a breadth of technical knowledge that enables a top-level view of the entire project. Using this perspective, you will act as an interface between the various technical specialties. You are expected to take ownership of issues that crosses the boundaries of several disciplines and use your broad skillset to ensure the success of the project.

##  **Qualifications**

 **Skill/Job Requirements:**

  * Minimum PhD plus at least 3 years of experience, in robotics-related field.
  * Demonstrate intuitive understanding of electro-mechanical phenomena with ability to do rigorous and detailed analysis.
  * C/C++ and Matlab programming skills, as well as hardware, software, and mechanism integration skills. Knowledge of Python would be a plus.
  * Knowledge of classical and modern servo control systems.
  * Knowledge of robot kinematics.
  * Knowledge of statistical methods is a plus.
  * Knowledge of electrical and mechanical design principles and CAD tools is a plus.
  * Demonstrate excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  * Have the ability to work independently, and the determination to get through challenging problems.

##  **Job Description**

 **Job Description:**

Software engineers at Intuitive Surgical strive to create the safest and
highest quality robotic system for minimally invasive surgery through the
development of highly reliable software as well as rigorous and robust
technical analysis. This software engineer position is responsible for
microcontroller software development and the design and analysis of algorithms
required to control surgical instruments.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

  * Design, develop, and test microcontroller software used on next generation surgical instruments. Producing high-quality software will involve:

o Working closely with electrical engineers, mechanical engineers, and systems
analyst to understand and document software requirements

o Understanding and designing SW interfaces for fast and robust communication
to ensure safety of mission critical data

o Writing the software needed to implement the necessary requirements

o Developing and executing test protocols to prove the software works reliably

  * Collaborate with the manufacturing team to develop automated procedures and fixtures for programing microcontrollers as well as calibrating, testing, and aiding assembly of instruments.
  * Implement features and algorithms to support new instruments, such as extending a cutter, or making decisions based on data from a new sensor.
  * Perform risk analysis and implement safety algorithms. This includes documenting risks, mitigations, and tests needed to support request for approval by regulatory agencies such as the FDA.
  * Lead by having a breadth of technical knowledge that enables a top-level view of the entire project. Using this perspective, you will act as an interface between the various technical specialties. You are expected to take ownership of issues that cross disciplinary boundaries and use your broad skillset to ensure the success of the project.

##  **Qualifications**

 **Skill/Job Requirements:**

  * MS (preferred) or BS in computer science, electrical engineering, or mechanical engineering with a focus on robotics or electro-mechanics.
  * Experience developing complete software solutions for embedded systems using C/C++.
  * Working knowledge of peripherals commonly used on embedded systems such as ADCs, DACs, PWM and serial communications (I2C, SPI, RS232)
  * Proven experience using electronic bench equipment such as oscilloscopes and function generators for the bring up and troubleshooting of hardware.
  * Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools and effective peer review techniques.
  * Knowledge of Matlab and/or Python.
  * Demonstrate intuitive understanding of mechanical phenomena with ability to do rigorous analysis.
  * Knowledge of servo control systems is a plus.
  * Knowledge of statistics is a plus.
  * Knowledge of Verilog is a plus.
  * Demonstrate excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  * Have the ability to work independently and the determination to solve challenging problems.

Job Title: Embedded Controls Software Engineer - Multiple Levels
Job Description:
## **Summary**

Posted: Apr 28, 2021

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200243345**

Come develop innovative control firmware for autonomous systems. The position
requires high level thinking to architect code solutions along with low-level
programming, excellent communication and leadership skills, and the ability to
work in a fast-paced environment. You will be a mentor to the junior members
of the team and will have the opportunity to lead cross-functional design with
mechanical, electrical, and controls engineers. Working on this technology you
will have the opportunity to have a major impact on the capability, user
experience, and quality of Apple's future products. Our collaborative
environment fosters innovation within a creative solution space.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * The ideal candidate will have at least 5+ years of real time embedded software development experience (design and implementation)
  * Outstanding proficiency in C on resource-constrained embedded platforms
  * Experience with Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS)
  * Working knowledge of standard hardware protocols (e.g. I2C, SPI, UART)
  * Experience with networking, concurrency, and distributed systems
  * Proficiency reading hardware specifications and schematics
  * Knowledge of operating systems concepts.
  * Proficiency debugging embedded software systems: familiarity with JTAG, oscilloscopes, etc.
  * Experience in motor controls and robotic actuators is beneficial
  * Experience with robust coding standards in safety-critical environments such as DO-178B/C, MISRA / ISO 26262, or IEC 61508 / 62304 are a plus
  * Experience with model-driven architecture and formal verification is desirable

## **Description**

In this role, you will design and implement control systems firmware for the
complex embedded systems that form the backbone of groundbreaking Apple
products. Working in a vibrant, collaborative environment, you will design,
implement, and integrate software for some of the most sophisticated
technologies on the planet. This position is ideal for candidates with a broad
engineering background, a passion for problem solving, and specific expertise
in firmware development. Backgrounds in multidisciplinary fields such as
consumer devices, medical devices, robotics, mechatronics, aerospace, and the
like would all be excellent preparation for the highly cross-functional
environment at Apple.

## **Education & Experience**

Bachelor of Science degree in one of CS, CE, EE plus five years in industry,
Masters plus three years, or equivalent experience.

## **Additional Requirements**

The Laser and Sensor Test Engineer applies the highest level of skill and
knowledge of laser optics, imaging, metrology, and optical-/electrical-based
sensors (health, motion, magnetic, environmental) in architecting
test/calibration stations for consumer electronics devices on a subassembly
and system level. You will drive conceptual test system hardware design with
technology groups in the early product exploration stage and validate first
article design in the lab. You will lead the end-to-end development of
software and hardware integration, including test flow, instrument control,
robotics/motion control, data capture and process, and integration of advanced
algorithms with third-party partners. You will be an optical or electrical
engineer expert for the team for consultation and also to design quick
prototypes to aid test station validation. You will be leading in documenting
and troubleshooting station hardware/software issues on test equipment and
systems and bridge to production. The ideal candidate is a self-driven
individual working in a cross-functional team environment and will be
responsible for planning the design, development, and implementation of
factory test/calibration systems. You will enforce manufacturability,
testability and ensure cost-effective designs are implemented for testing and
automation systems, software, and equipment. This position will have
responsibilities for NTI (New Technology Introduction) and NPI test
development and bridge to sustaining support of production. You must be
responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer
environment. We are looking for someone with a productive mindset who can
apply their expertise to solve problems in creative, insightful ways.  
  
  

### **Laser and Sensor Test Engineer Responsibilities:**  

  * Develop and deploy advanced manufacturing-ready laser and sensor test stations for Meta AR/VR consumer electronics products.
  * Coordinates third-party vendors in designing, fabricating and developing test systems.
  * Develop and deploy end-to-end test software including test sequence, motion stage/robotics control, image capturing/processing and data transaction interface to defined IT infrastructure.
  * Drive third-party vendors to develop and customize instruments (including camera, lens, sensor, light source, etc.) that meet the unique requirements of test systems.
  * Analyze, evaluate, design, integrate and test the first article fixture to meet specification and proof of concept.
  * Lead functional technology groups and drive cross-functional decisions on test development and architecture.
  * Validation of test SW/FW releases, including repeatability and negative testing, and coordinate SW upgrades with fixture integrator and CM/JDM partners.
  * Troubleshoot and debug test systems and automation solutions from a software and hardware perspective in full autonomy.
  * Support failure analysis on systems and use data to improve test strategies and processes.
  * Serve as subject matter expert for the test team for sensitive electrical and/or laser measurements.
  * Work with vendors and firmware/electrical design team to design prototype or driver boards (e.g. for camera or sensors) and FPCs for rapid prototypes.
  * Travel up to 25%, includes domestics and International travels for prototype builds support, mass production sustaining, and collaboration with R&D teams.

  
  
  

### **Minimum Qualifications:**  

  * Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Optics or related field.
  * 2+ years of experience in developing test/calibration solutions in a consumer electronics or related field.
  * 2+ years of experience in at least one of the two areas: Optical metrology (spectrometer, radiometer, imaging optics, color sensor, etc.) or High-precision sensitive electrical signal measurements, including noise shielding and suppression.
  * Experience with designing complicated test systems integrating instruments, mechanical motion, electrical controls, and test software.
  * Experience with programming languages such as Python, C/C++, and data processing tools such as MATLAB, JMP and Minitab.
  * Experience in statistical methods (distributions, SPC, Cpk, etc.) for data analytics.

  
  
  

### **Preferred Qualifications:**  

  * Master/Ph.D. in Physics, Electrical Engineering, or Optics.
  * Experience with laser safety classification and the required tests.
  * Experience with health sensors (e.g. heart rate, oximeter), electrical-based sensors (e.g. electromyography), optical-based sensors (e.g. ambient light), or environmental sensors (e.g. magnetometer, proximity).
  * Experience with standard communication buses (I2C, SPI, UART, etc.).
  * Software skills: Python proficiency, image processing algorithms.
  * 5+ years experience with factory tests for consumer electronics products for NPI and mass production.
  * Experience with managing multiple third-party vendors from evaluation, down-selection, and driving deliverables to meet project requirements.

An Aerospace client is looking for a **Mission Space Engineer** to support new
mission concept formulations as a space telecommunications subject matter
expert, including concurrent engineering, rapid mission formulation Team X.

  

  
**Location** : Pasadena, CA 91109  
**Position** : Mission Space Engineer  
**Duration** : 12 months  
**Pay rate:** $51.35 – 78.20/hr. DOE (depending on experience)  
**Flexible work schedule** : 9/80 or 5/40

**We do offer paid time offs, holidays, 401k, medical, dental, and vision**

  

  
**Position Summary** :

**Responsibilities** :

  * Will design high-level telecom subsystems to meet mission requirements including total downlink data volume, radiometric navigation, and command uplinks
  * Will calculate telecom link margins using a statistically derived design control table and manage and track changes to reduce uncertainties
  * Will perform analyses to support trade studies such as telecom hardware selection (e.g. radios, antenna types), frequency band selection, modulation and coding selection, etc.
  * Will generate subsystem, box, and module-level requirements with full requirements traceability and flow-down using requirements management systems such as DOORS.
  * Will negotiate interface agreements with other subsystem elements and partner interfaces; document agreed requirements as interface requirements and control documents
  * Will manage requirement changes through Engineering Change Requests (ECR) with Change Control Board (CCB) concurrence and approvals
  * Will evaluate compliance against JPL Design Principles (DP) and Flight Project Practices (FPP)
  * Will assist in the preparation of verification and validation (V&V) plans.
  * Will support the design of RF & digital hardware, software, and firmware for radio and digital processor developments.
  * Will plan and help execute ambient and environmental test campaigns for prototype, engineering model, and flight model radio technologies.
  * Will track and document mass, power and data volume specifications and budgets for telecom components and subsystem.
  * Will support Hardware Review/Certification Requirements (HRCR) and Certificate of Flight Readiness (CoFR) reviews for flight deliveries.
  * Will support the product manager in managing risks, performance error budgets, trade studies, design integration, and maintaining delivery schedules.

  

**Required Skills** :

  * Bachelor’s degree in engineering, physical sciences, or mathematics with a minimum of 6 years of professional experience, or Master’s degree with 4 years of experience, or Ph.D with 2 years of experience.
  * Demonstrated skills in designing, implementing, and testing electronic hardware or instruments that are used within complex space systems.
  * Experience within a multidisciplinary system engineering or test team
  * Demonstrated knowledge of processes that are used to verify/validate the design requirements of systems.
  * Experience in testing of systems, including test planning, test procedure development, and data analysis.
  * Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
  * Ability to collaborate successfully with other groups, sections, divisions, and organizations, both inside and outside JPL.
  * Experience with development of formal procedures and documentation relating to space flight hardware
  * Ability to react to frequent changes in plans and excel in a rapid pace concurrent engineering environment.
  * Understanding of the proper application of JPL design principles, flight project practices, hardware-handling constraints, and the JPL risk management practices.
  * Wide-ranging experience and knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Spacecraft Telecom Systems Engineering, Software Defined Radios Design Principles, RF Design, Digital & Analog Hardware Design, Embedded Software and Firmware, and Digital & RF Ground Support Equipment.
  * Hands-on experience in the development and test of both telecom systems and embedded digital hardware, as well demonstrated ability to understand and debug/troubleshoot complex systems

  

**Desired Skills** :

  * Knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.
  * Some understanding and application experience with all aspects of spacecraft telecom systems engineering for earth orbiting missions including telecom architecture, design, link budgets, spacecraft interfaces for high-speed data and low speed telemetry, EMI issues and mitigation, spectrum planning, ground station use planning.
  * Experience with development, documentation and execution of radio system tests, including formal validation and verification tracking for fulfillment of requirements.
  * Experience with designing Software Defined Radios (SDR)
  * Understanding and application of advanced principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in Modulation and Coding, RF hardware including antenna and front-end hardware, link design and modeling, networking hardware and protocols, RF hardware testing and test automation.
  * Knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to Digital Signal Processing, Digital Filter Design, Digital Modem Design, Equalization, signal tracking loops, demodulation processes, channel coding/decoding.
  * Proficiency with a range of tools for numerical analysis, electronic design, firmware, embedded software, and/or testing automation.
  * Direct experience with flight telecom component development and delivery.
  * Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, including the ability to interact with project, program, and line management and the engineering team.

  

  
At a minimum, a 7-year background check, education verification, employment
