Job summary  
Excited about robotics, and how they will be used in our everyday lives? The
Amazon Consumer Robotics group brings together new advancements in artificial
intelligence, computer vision, sensor and motor technology, voice and edge
computing to push the boundaries of what’s possible.  
  
The Role  
As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will work cross-functionally with other
exceptional engineers to develop robust and efficient firmware solutions. Our
technology team delivers firmware for controlling and interfacing with
Amazon’s latest consumer devices, including consumer robotics. We are looking
for driven software engineers with a passion for working hands-on with
electromechanical systems and turning their ideas into reality to join our
team. Your work will have a direct impact on getting Amazon’s next generation
of products into the hands of millions of customers.  
  
If you have a passion for creating, learning in a dynamic, fast-paced
environment, and writing code that brings hardware to life, come join us and
see what we’re building next!

 _  
OffWorld is a robotics startup working on developing a mobile robotic

formidable engineering challenges at NASA, ESA, NOAA, Maxar Technologies,

optimization. Our robotic systems combine sensory information with cutting

**Benefits:**  

  * Opportunity to be part of our core team, with a strong influence on the direction of the company and our initial product
  * Competitive salary and equity based on experience and contribution
  * Experience working with some of the leading experts in human-robot interaction
  * Work on challenging problems that promise to radically change the future of healthcare 
  * Live and work in Austin, TX. Home of SXSW, ACL, ranked #1 best city to live in 2017, 2018, and 2019 by US News: https://realestate.usnews.com/places/texas/austin

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do
not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,
gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability
status

Rugged Robotics is on a mission to empower the construction industry to build
better by innovating new approaches to tough problems using automation. We are
a fast-paced start-up environment where every employee takes on many roles and
wears many hats. To help our customers to build better, we need to build the
best team.

The software team at Rugged Robotics is responsible for prototyping,
developing, and implementing software solutions that power the automation of
our construction layout robots. As a **Robotics Software Engineer** working on
robots at a start-up, you will be solving problems and improving functionality
on real-world products while also creating innovative solutions for our next
generation of robots.

**The Role**

  * Architect and build novel software features for mobile robots that tackle tough problems with robotic control, motion planning, perception, and localization.
  * Iteratively prototype and test software directly on hardware platforms in our labs and on our customer's jobsites.
  * Improve the speed, precision, and reliability of our current platform by investigating, modifying and refining existing software features.
  * Collaborate with team-members working in the field to determine the root-cause of issues and quickly generate solutions.
  * Make informed & objective engineering decisions by creating simulations, methodically running experiments, and conducting analyses with a range of techniques.

**You Are**

  * Experienced with 2+ years of software development on robotic systems, comfortable with ROS, Python, & C++, and familiar with common coding practices including revision control and CI/CM
  * Ready to take code from concept to implementation on a product that exceeds the customer's expectations.
  * Knowledgeable with relevant areas of robotics & control such as kinematics, sensor fusion, path planning, perception, calibration algorithms, and firmware development.
  * Hands-on with deploying code on physical hardware and root causing bugs related to mechanical, electrical, and software issues.
  * Highly collaborative across function boundaries, including Mechanical, Electrical and Operations Engineers.
  * Eager to learn new technologies, want to grow as an individual with our organization, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.
  * Able to and enjoy traveling on the job to see your product in action and learning from our customers.

**Great to Have**

  * Experience architecting complete software solutions
  * Comfortable with project leadership, team growth and mentoring.
  * Understanding of robotic systems such as motors, transmissions, and sensors.
  * Familiar with docker and software releases to a fleet of machines.

**Perks**

  * A full time, competitive salary with equity
  * Flexible paid vacation from day one
  * Paid Parental Leave
  * Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance
  * 401k Plan available

Rugged Robotics is headquartered in Houston, TX in the vibrant neighborhood of
East Downtown. This role requires close collaboration with teammates, and we
value the interactions that come from working together around the robots in
the lab.

Interested in Rugged Robotics but don't tick all the boxes? Don't see a role
that meets your skills? Reach out, let us know how you think you can
contribute to the team, and define your own position.

Rugged Robotics is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we value diversity at
our company. All qualified candidates will receive consideration regardless of
race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity, age,
national origin, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other
protected legal status.

RIOS is a technology company helping global customers automate their
factories, warehouses, and supply chain operations by deploying a new class of
AI-powered and dexterous robots. RIOS robots handle hard-to-automate tasks,
typically requiring human-level dexterity, in unstructured environments. RIOS
is headquartered in Palo Alto, CA and has a pilot facility in San Carlos, CA.
More information is available at www.rios.ai

 **The Role**

RIOS is looking for an Robotics Controls Development Engineer that can own the
application logic and related robotics controls pipeline development for
various customer use cases. This typically will include leveraging existing
pipeline tools in different ways, along with a degree of custom development,
to meet customer KPI's.

 **As a Robotics Controls and Development Engineer you will:**

  * Work daily on multiple robot platforms with custom hardware and software stacks
  * Push hardware and technology limits to solve real-world problems.
  * Work with a multidisciplinary team to solve previously unsolvable robotics problems
  * Travel to customer sites to deploy robotic solutions.

 **Technical attributes of candidates may include:**

  * M.S./Ph.D. in Robotics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent industry experience)
  * Experience with Robot Operating System (ROS) Proficiency with robotics hardware and systems (e.g., electrical, mechanical, sensing)
  * Experience with C/C++, Python
  * Familiarity with aspects of robotic control including 3D perception, path planning, kinematics, etc.
  * Best practices in software development such as documentation, version control, testing and reproducibility
  * Experience with real-time operating system
  * Actively practice the Git-based CI/CD workflow

 **Perks**

  * Competitive salary package & Stock options for every employee
  * Healthcare + dental + vision insurance plans
  * 401(k) plan
  * Free lunch
  * Flexible time off & paid holidays
  * Social events + happy hours + team parties

Join us!

**OVERVIEW**

At Cambridge Consultants we get to tackle some of the toughest problems faced
by the medical industry. Our clients range from small start-ups to large
multinationals all over the world. The technology that we encounter and build
in our work varies from one project to the next as we aim to advance the
state-of-the-art in healthcare. Your talent and depth of experience in
developing novel robotic control systems is what will be behind tomorrow’s
computer-assisted surgical tools and medical devices.

 **YOUR ROLE**

Cambridge Consultants is a technical consultancy with hundreds of world-class
engineers. We take on a large variety of challenging projects with a focus on
delivering breakthrough innovations. As a Senior Robotic Controls Engineer,
you will get the opportunity to learn new skills and work in diverse
applications with a wide range of technologies including hyperspectral
imaging, advanced robotic manipulators, and machine learning. In this role,
you will help create the next generation of medical devices ranging from
surgical navigation and advanced visualization to intelligent robotic systems
for the future of digital surgery. Each project is a new opportunity to learn
and deliver.

 **DAY TO DAY:**

  * Contribute to early-stage development through analysis of novel concepts.
  * Perform rigorous kinematic and dynamic modelling and simulation.
  * Develop and test control algorithms for complex electromechanical systems.
  * Work closely with the mechanical design team to develop mechanisms to meet aggressive performance targets.
  * Lead discipline expertise in robotic system control algorithms, modelling, simulation, and optimization within cross-functional teams.
  * Lead and support internal efforts to develop new technology offerings.

 **WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED**

 **MUST HAVE:**

MS or Ph.D (preferred) in engineering with an emphasis on robotics, dynamics,
controls, or equivalent degree

  * Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship
  * Excellent communication skills
  * Deep knowledge of robot manipulator kinematics and dynamics
  * Matlab and either C++ (preferred) or python programming skills
  * Experience with ROS

 **BONUS POINTS:**

  * Experience with tele-operated robotic systems
  * Experience in continuum robotics
  * Experience with surgical applications
  * Experience with real-time software applications and RTOS
  * Knowledge of probabilistic, computer vision, or machine learning techniques

Job Title: Embedded Systems Engineer / Programmger - Mobile Robotics
Job Description:
**Job Summary:**  
Programmer required for the system design of the Automated Guided Vehicle
(AGV) system for company. This position will require in-depth knowledge of AGV
systems and current technologies in the markerplace. The AGV programmer evelop
software and algorithms that improve how our industrial Automated Guided
Vehicles (AGVs) sense, understand and react. The AGV programmer will be
responsible for performing system design, testing and maintenance. Experience
with the design and implementation of manufacturing control software specific
to AGVs is a must.

C++ programming experience preferred, but Java is also acceptable. Must have
experience working with open source software as well as writing proprietary
software.

We develop a broad range of low level and embedded software powering motion
control, vision, robotics, computing and IOT. You can be involved in the
entire design process, such as discussing requirements with our customers,
writing specifications, conceptual and detailed designing, qualification and
finally releasing for production. We are looking for software engineers with a
strong affinity towards electronics, who are not afraid to open up a
schematics document to customize software for our integrated solutions. If
tuning your applications for different CPU/GPU/FPGA/Hybrid architectures,
multi core/multi CPU and other optimization techniques is what interests you,
join our team as an Embedded Software Engineer!

 **Essential Functions and Responsibilities:**

  * Program and update a system that will provide the required transport of materials by AGV for a given facility.
  * Lead design and programming meetings including other sub-consultants with technical system details for coordination.
  * Discover and correct fatal flaws in system design or revisions by others that may negatively impact system performance.
  * Perform various analyses to create and adjust system design, building spaces and operations.
  * Perform on-site or remote tele-inspections during system installation to adhere to specifications.
  * Creating reports to provide findings and recommendations.
  * Performs other related duties as assigned.
  * Design, develop and test of C++ computer applications
  * Work with real time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded platforms.
  * Strong background in embedded / network software development, and knowledge of Embedded Object-Oriented Development methodologies and approaches.
  * Designing and debugging experience with multi-threading application with embedded systems architecture.
  * Strong code development history using software to solve real-world problems.
  * Working knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
  * Ability to write new mobile robot software features.
  * Ability to write software for real time hardware I/O control and feedback analysis
  * Knowledge of object-oriented design methodologies and design patterns
  * Experience programming serial, CAN and network communications (UDP and TCP)
  * Experience with issue tracking systems, specific experience with Jira is a plus
  * Experience with versions control systems, specific experience with Git/Sub version a plus
  * Experience with writing requirements, design documentation, and test cases
  * Working knowledge of electronic and electromechanical devices such as analog inputs and outputs, encoders, proximity sensors, etc.

 **Knowledge, Education, Skills, and Experience:**

  * Detailed knowledge of AGV systems from all large global manufacturers
  * Knowledge of each vendors components and features including vehicles, navigation systems, and capabilities.
  * Project management and communication skills to provide timely deliverables, develop and maintain client relations, monitor work scope and financials in contract and lead internal effort for assistance.
  * Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience that would provide the required knowledge and abilities.
  * Bachelors degree in architecture, engineering or related field and or having performed the required duties with an AGV manufacturer.

  * Requires a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, automation technology, robotics or equivalent work experience.
  * 3-7 years programming experience writing application software using C++ for technical applications.
  * Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded platforms.
  * Ability to troubleshoot software issues in a comprehensive and creative manner.
  * Apply object-oriented design and development techniques, using C++ programming.
  * Assist with version control and release management.

 **What we offer:**

  * Transparent leadership team – business goals and objectives regularly communicated through monthly meetings
  * Opportunity for growth in a booming industry

  * Casual work environment
  * Company culture of continuous improvement
  * On-site or Remote work available

**About Us**

Here at ViaBot, we're building a robot made to tackle real-world tasks. We're
a robotics startup based in the heart of Silicon Valley, with a forward-
thinking and exceptional team that's ever-growing. Our aim is to change the
way people see robots--not as gimmicks or as one-trick ponies, but as sensible
solutions to sizable problems. Enter RUNO: an autonomous mobile robot designed
to handle outdoor commercial tasks, such as sweeping and grass cutting. Learn
more about us at: https://www.viabot.com

 **Responsibilities**

ViaBot is looking for a passionate Robotics Software Engineer looking to get
involved with all aspects of the development of autonomous UGVs as a viable
commercial solution. Our ideal candidate is resourceful, hard-working, and not
afraid to get their hands dirty while developing, testing, and maintaining
these bots. They will be responsible for:

  * Hands-on development with our autonomous mobile robot, RUNO
  * Supporting the testing and deployment of our robots onto the field
  * Integration of different sensors and subsystems used on our robot platform RUNO
  * Managing system state both on the microcontroller and Linux levels
  * Exposing diagnostics for both ease of development and for fleet monitoring
  * Optimizing and reduce existing code for both performance and readability
  * Improvising and handling responsibilities outside of the job description

 **Initial tasks will include:**

  * Implementing unit tests on the microcontroller code level for pre-deployment
  * Implementing process tests to be executed remotely and safely
  * Incorporate various sensors with UART-based interfaces
  * Handle many control loops in a single loop-based architecture with limited threading
  * Manage all inter-device messaging over CAN bus
  * Writing health-monitoring nodes in rospy/roscpp to ensure system reliability and ease of debugging
  * Working with our web engineers to expose robot diagnostics and data to our internal web services for fleet management

 **Qualifications:**

  * M.S./B.S. in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
  * Hands-on experience developing robotics, IoT, or computer vision systems
  * Fluency in ROS, C/C++, and software development
  * Experience designing and building software for professional settings
  * Having a vehicle is highly recommended (we do on-site robot maintenance!)
  * Must have work authorization in the United States
  * Not a remote position
  * Must provide proof of vaccination on first day

 **Compensation: $110,000 - $120,000 / yr, plus benefits and stock options**

**Summary**

Provide systems and process analysis in support of identification of
automation opportunities. Provide automation design, development, testing,
quality assurance, implementation and training support to multiple client
operating units. Typical duties include capturing user requirements;
performing coding and data modeling, testing, quality assurance, software
configuration management, design, and program documentation; build and deploy,
implementation; upgrade; and maintaining interoperability/integration between
systems.

 **Essential Duties & Responsibilities**

  * Implement automation cells to increase efficiency in the manufacturing facility and assembly department
  * Production support and troubleshooting as needed
  * Propose, define, prioritize, and manage automation/robotics projects
  * Electrical design and component selection
  * Drive process improvements using automation
  * Develop troubleshooting guides and procedures
  * Work closely with Process engineering, Operations and quality team to solve operational problems and improve efficiency and quality.

 **Education and Experience**

This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in engineering. This position
should have a minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience. Experience with Lean
Manufacturing a plus.  
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  * Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or a related discipline (required)
  * 5+ years of experience (required)
  * Experience with PLC’s, CNC mills, and other common manufacturing equipment preferred
  * Project management, and process development experience
  * Extensive experience in automation and robotics

Work Environment/Physical Demands/Equipment Used  
This position is located in a manufacturing facility which requires prolonged
sitting, standing, walking, squatting, twisting, and bending. This position
will spend about 50% of their time on the production floor where heavy
machinery is present and loud sounds exist. Requires lifting up to 50 lbs.
Requires manual dexterity for typing and considerable time at a computer.  
Health and Safety – PPE Requirements  
Safety Glasses to be worn at all times when on the production floor

## **Summary**

Posted: Apr 13, 2022

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200361818**

Do you like robotics and want make a positive impact on the direction of new
technologies in consumer products? We are seeking a creative and motivated
Systems Quality Robotic Automation Engineer with excellent analytical,
programming, problem-solving and communication skills to join our Systems
Quality team that works to ensure world-changing products are delivered at a
high-quality to all our customers. Come join our team, where you will build
robotic solutions to test Apple products, ensuring their outstanding quality
before they reach customers!

## **Key Qualifications**

  * Proficiency creating and using robotics/mechatronics to build automated solutions.
  * Proficiency in coding (preferably Python).
  * Proficiency with CAD tools like NX or Solidworks.
  * Experience working with a wide range of sensors and actuators.
  * Experience building circuits/systems that interface with sensors and actuators.
  * Experience working with development boards like Arduino.
  * Ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
  * Strong attention to detail and strive for the best product for our customers.
  * Ability to work in teams and collaborate.

## **Description**

\- Design, engineer, maintain, and run robotic automated test systems,
incorporating actuators, sensors and software to interface, trigger and sense
hardware and software features in Apple products. - Design components for
robotic automation using CAD tools, and generate their drawings for
fabrication. - Analyze automation results, and use them to regress, isolate,
report and quantify the impact of all issues found. - Collaborate with
engineering, QA & program management teams to plan and deliver the most
effective and impactful ways to test and solve short and long-term problems. -
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to run experiments and analyze their
data in order to drive positive change in Apple products. - Advocate for the
customer and drive for the highest quality at all levels of the product. -
Develop and maintain clean test automation frameworks and test cases. - Report
status on a regular basis and meet target times.

## **Education & Experience**

\- BS in ME, EE, CE, CS, or equivalent engineering degree (MS preferred)

## **Additional Requirements**

  * Nice to have:
    * Experience in computer vision (openCV).
    * Experience with applied mathematics (e.g. linear algebra, transformation matrices).
    * Experience with coding apps for iOS.
    * SQA or System Test experience, preferably on consumer-facing HW/SW products.
    * Experience with Machine Learning.
    * In-depth understanding of iOS, OS X, or Unix.
  * If you are a Colorado resident, this is for you: At Apple, we see the whole you. We carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors, including your background and experience. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary. Systems Quality Robotics Automation Engineer starts at a minimum hourly rate of $39.08/hr. The actual pay may be higher depending on your skills, qualifications, and experience. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Every Apple employee also has the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder, because all team members are eligible for stock grants and also a discount when purchasing Apple stock.
  * We offer all kinds of ways to experience well-being, confidence, and satisfaction. Learn more about Apple benefits.
  * Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements.

Job Title: Embedded Controls Software Engineer - Multiple Levels
Job Description:
## **Summary**

Posted: Apr 28, 2021

Weekly Hours: **40**

Role Number: **200243345**

Come develop innovative control firmware for autonomous systems. The position
requires high level thinking to architect code solutions along with low-level
programming, excellent communication and leadership skills, and the ability to
work in a fast-paced environment. You will be a mentor to the junior members
of the team and will have the opportunity to lead cross-functional design with
mechanical, electrical, and controls engineers. Working on this technology you
will have the opportunity to have a major impact on the capability, user
experience, and quality of Apple's future products. Our collaborative
environment fosters innovation within a creative solution space.

## **Key Qualifications**

  * The ideal candidate will have at least 5+ years of real time embedded software development experience (design and implementation)
  * Outstanding proficiency in C on resource-constrained embedded platforms
  * Experience with Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS)
  * Working knowledge of standard hardware protocols (e.g. I2C, SPI, UART)
  * Experience with networking, concurrency, and distributed systems
  * Proficiency reading hardware specifications and schematics
  * Knowledge of operating systems concepts.
  * Proficiency debugging embedded software systems: familiarity with JTAG, oscilloscopes, etc.
  * Experience in motor controls and robotic actuators is beneficial
  * Experience with robust coding standards in safety-critical environments such as DO-178B/C, MISRA / ISO 26262, or IEC 61508 / 62304 are a plus
  * Experience with model-driven architecture and formal verification is desirable

## **Description**

In this role, you will design and implement control systems firmware for the
complex embedded systems that form the backbone of groundbreaking Apple
products. Working in a vibrant, collaborative environment, you will design,
implement, and integrate software for some of the most sophisticated
technologies on the planet. This position is ideal for candidates with a broad
engineering background, a passion for problem solving, and specific expertise
in firmware development. Backgrounds in multidisciplinary fields such as
consumer devices, medical devices, robotics, mechatronics, aerospace, and the
like would all be excellent preparation for the highly cross-functional
environment at Apple.

## **Education & Experience**

Bachelor of Science degree in one of CS, CE, EE plus five years in industry,
Masters plus three years, or equivalent experience.

## **Additional Requirements**

* 8 Month contract opportunity - W2
  * Compensation: $48.00 - $55.00/hr
  * Worksite: 1050 Kifer Rd, Sunnyvale, CA, 94086

  
We’re Intuitive: a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and a
pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery. Working closely with hospital teams,
we’re developing integrated solutions that help enable physicians to get
patients back to what matters most. Our technology has been used in nearly 10
million operations across 67 countries.

Together, we’ve dedicated more than two decades for innovating for better care
through enhanced experiences, improved efficiencies, and reduced cost of care.
In this role, you will join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a
global community of healthcare professionals and their patients.

 **  
Primary Function of Position:**

The New Product Verification Department plays a vital role in product and
process quality, in new product development and production, and in the quality
of da Vinci Surgical System product lines, including endoscopic
instrumentation, and supporting accessories. The Test Engineer will work with
a team of dedicated individuals within New Product Development and New Product
Verification to assure quality of new designs; to identify issues related to
new designs and processes, and to work with other Test Engineers to develop
harmonized test methods and best practices. Focus for this position will be on
testing of single-use and/or multi-use instruments/endoscopes/accessories used
with Da Vinci and other Intuitive products.

 **  
Roles & Responsibilities:**

General Test Engineering Duties:

  * Generates test protocols for Design Verification, Label Verification and Life/Reliability tests
  * Executes test protocols for clinically relevant surgical simulation and automated testing utilizing da Vinci Surgical Systems and other test equipment
  * Identifies and reports problems that arise during testing, and escalates new or persistent failure modes to appropriate engineering teams
  * Creates Test Reports to provide documentation that clearly indicates the results of product testing

Test Protocol Development:

  * Works with Design Engineers to develop test methods needed to ensure design requirements are sufficiently verified
  * Works with Test Engineers and Design Engineers to develop concepts and approaches to fixture designs and to create and implement harmonized test methods

Test Fixture Development:

  * Designs and qualifies test fixtures, test scripts and other test aids needed to perform Design Verification, and Life/Reliability tests on instruments and accessories used with da Vinci and other Intuitive products.
  * Works with Design Engineering teams to ensure testability of Instrument, Accessory or Endoscope products, including both the electrical and mechanical aspects of these products
  * Responsible for documentation of fixtures utilizing SolidWorks, including release of documents into Agile (document control system)

Other Responsibilities:

  * Performs a broad variety of tasks in support of product verification and test process design as assigned by department management

An Aerospace client is looking for a **Mission Space Engineer** to support new
mission concept formulations as a space telecommunications subject matter
expert, including concurrent engineering, rapid mission formulation Team X.

  

  
**Location** : Pasadena, CA 91109  
**Position** : Mission Space Engineer  
**Duration** : 12 months  
**Pay rate:** $51.35 – 78.20/hr. DOE (depending on experience)  
**Flexible work schedule** : 9/80 or 5/40

**We do offer paid time offs, holidays, 401k, medical, dental, and vision**

  

  
**Position Summary** :

**Responsibilities** :

  * Will design high-level telecom subsystems to meet mission requirements including total downlink data volume, radiometric navigation, and command uplinks
  * Will calculate telecom link margins using a statistically derived design control table and manage and track changes to reduce uncertainties
  * Will perform analyses to support trade studies such as telecom hardware selection (e.g. radios, antenna types), frequency band selection, modulation and coding selection, etc.
  * Will generate subsystem, box, and module-level requirements with full requirements traceability and flow-down using requirements management systems such as DOORS.
  * Will negotiate interface agreements with other subsystem elements and partner interfaces; document agreed requirements as interface requirements and control documents
  * Will manage requirement changes through Engineering Change Requests (ECR) with Change Control Board (CCB) concurrence and approvals
  * Will evaluate compliance against JPL Design Principles (DP) and Flight Project Practices (FPP)
  * Will assist in the preparation of verification and validation (V&V) plans.
  * Will support the design of RF & digital hardware, software, and firmware for radio and digital processor developments.
  * Will plan and help execute ambient and environmental test campaigns for prototype, engineering model, and flight model radio technologies.
  * Will track and document mass, power and data volume specifications and budgets for telecom components and subsystem.
  * Will support Hardware Review/Certification Requirements (HRCR) and Certificate of Flight Readiness (CoFR) reviews for flight deliveries.
  * Will support the product manager in managing risks, performance error budgets, trade studies, design integration, and maintaining delivery schedules.

  

**Required Skills** :

  * Bachelor’s degree in engineering, physical sciences, or mathematics with a minimum of 6 years of professional experience, or Master’s degree with 4 years of experience, or Ph.D with 2 years of experience.
  * Demonstrated skills in designing, implementing, and testing electronic hardware or instruments that are used within complex space systems.
  * Experience within a multidisciplinary system engineering or test team
  * Demonstrated knowledge of processes that are used to verify/validate the design requirements of systems.
  * Experience in testing of systems, including test planning, test procedure development, and data analysis.
  * Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
  * Ability to collaborate successfully with other groups, sections, divisions, and organizations, both inside and outside JPL.
  * Experience with development of formal procedures and documentation relating to space flight hardware
  * Ability to react to frequent changes in plans and excel in a rapid pace concurrent engineering environment.
  * Understanding of the proper application of JPL design principles, flight project practices, hardware-handling constraints, and the JPL risk management practices.
  * Wide-ranging experience and knowledge in one or more of the following areas: Spacecraft Telecom Systems Engineering, Software Defined Radios Design Principles, RF Design, Digital & Analog Hardware Design, Embedded Software and Firmware, and Digital & RF Ground Support Equipment.
  * Hands-on experience in the development and test of both telecom systems and embedded digital hardware, as well demonstrated ability to understand and debug/troubleshoot complex systems

  

**Desired Skills** :

  * Knowledge of Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations across a range of applications.
  * Some understanding and application experience with all aspects of spacecraft telecom systems engineering for earth orbiting missions including telecom architecture, design, link budgets, spacecraft interfaces for high-speed data and low speed telemetry, EMI issues and mitigation, spectrum planning, ground station use planning.
  * Experience with development, documentation and execution of radio system tests, including formal validation and verification tracking for fulfillment of requirements.
  * Experience with designing Software Defined Radios (SDR)
  * Understanding and application of advanced principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in Modulation and Coding, RF hardware including antenna and front-end hardware, link design and modeling, networking hardware and protocols, RF hardware testing and test automation.
  * Knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to Digital Signal Processing, Digital Filter Design, Digital Modem Design, Equalization, signal tracking loops, demodulation processes, channel coding/decoding.
  * Proficiency with a range of tools for numerical analysis, electronic design, firmware, embedded software, and/or testing automation.
  * Direct experience with flight telecom component development and delivery.
  * Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, including the ability to interact with project, program, and line management and the engineering team.

  

  
At a minimum, a 7-year background check, education verification, employment

Treeswift is building robots to operate in the world’s most complex
environments. We are looking for a Robotics Engineer to build the systems and
algorithms which enable our robots to fly underneath the forest canopy and
extract actionable forest metrics. Robotics encompasses the state estimation,
mapping, planning, and control for robot autonomy in cluttered forest
environments. It also entails the multi-robot coverage and planning algorithms
to enable large scale coverage of forest environments. As a member of the
Robotics team, you will design, implement, and field test advanced robotics
algorithms on real systems in the most exciting and challenging environment,
the forest.

We are a mission-driven company that places our customer needs front and
center. As a result, some days will feature heavy development in the lab, and
other days will feature rigorous testing in customer forests. We are solving
problems that no one has solved before, so having an innovative mindset with
an excitement for diving deep into the messiness of real-world robotics is
critical.

You will:

  * Develop state-of-the-art algorithms in one or all of the following areas: SLAM, multi-sensor fusion, LiDAR perception, computer vision, deep learning, multi-robot coverage and planning etc.
  * Travel to field deployments with the goal of fast iteration cycles between development and field testing.
  * Benchmark and evaluate algorithm improvement against clearly defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to quantify algorithm effectiveness.
  * Be asked to learn and work on problems you may never have worked on before.

What we look for::

  * The team operates in a production setting both in the field and on the cloud. The ideal candidate has strong software engineering skills and the ability to write production level code (unit tests, debugging/profiling, version control).
  * The ideal candidate should be proficient in Linux, ROS, C++, Python, git, and have experience with drones, LiDAR, and camera sensors.
  * The team works with physical systems in rugged environments, so familiarity with field deployment is ideal.
  * The ideal candidate is willing and excited to travel around the United States and the world to customer sites for extended periods of time.

We expect you to:

  * Be direct and unafraid to voice your opinion succinctly.
  * Have a clear understanding of your own strengths and weaknesses, and seek to help the team based on your strengths, and learn from others to improve your weaknesses.
  * Be truth-seeking and scientific in your approach, but also efficient and have a get-things-done attitude.
  * Thrive in a dynamic, diverse, team-oriented environment.
  * Be open to criticism and feedback.
  * Have high standards and levels of excellence - we are a team of world-class roboticists, data scientists, and foresters, and we like to work with the best.

**Who we are:**

Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust.
With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some
of the world's largest automakers, we're building self-driving technology that
is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions.

Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it
safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to
impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to
deliveries.

**Meet the team:**

A backup compute system like the Complementary Autonomous Vehicle System
(CAVS) is critical to producing a truly self-driving solution. If the main AVS
enters a degraded state CAVS is designed to take control and safely guide the
vehicle. To do this CAVS is always running in the background ready to take
over control of the AVS at a moment's notice. This team works with teams
across Argo to design and implement algorithmically diverse, safety-quality
solutions that execute under rigorous real time constraints. Ultimately the
goal of the team is to have CAVS intervene at the correct time and under the
correct conditions to reduce the risk to the vehicle and other road users.
This position requires strong robotics fundamentals and software engineering
skills.

**What you'll do:**

  * Implement libraries, algorithms, and tools for a state of the art Complementary Autonomous Vehicle System
  * Test and field these algorithms for real-time operation on autonomous vehicles at scale in challenging environments
  * Collaborate with engineers across a variety of teams to brainstorm and accelerate development of CAVS capabilities
  * Coordinate data collection to select and label relevant data to improve the algorithms and develop metrics by which the system is evaluated

**What you'll need to succeed:**

  * Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
  * Software engineering skills in real-time, computationally efficient systems
  * Working experience in C++
  * Working knowledge of python
  * Applied knowledge of lidar and/or radar perception systems
  * Applied knowledge of mobile robotic systems
  * Strong presentation and communication skills

**Nice to haves:**

  * Strong desire for candidates with hands on experience that have deployed real products or platforms into the real world and intimately understand the challenges of working with complex systems
  * Previous experience with AEB systems
  * Experience in Linux environments is desired

**What we offer you:**

  * High-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance
  * Competitive compensation packages
  * Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan with immediate vesting
  * Employer-paid group term life insurance and the option to elect voluntary life insurance
  * Paid parental leave
  * Paid medical leave
  * Unlimited vacation
  * Complimentary daily lunches, beverages, and snacks
  * Pre-tax commuter benefits
  * Monthly wellness stipend
  * Professional development reimbursement
  * Employee assistance program
  * Discounted programs that include legal services, identity theft protection, pet insurance, and more
  * Company and team bonding outlets: employee resource groups, quarterly team activity stipend, and wellness initiatives

**Our Background:**

Argo AI was founded in late 2016 by industry experts with extensive experience
building robotic systems for commercial applications. Our once-small team has
since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic
partnerships with two of the world's leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen.
Our self-driving system is the first with commercial deployment plans for
Europe and the U.S., and thanks to an ability to tap into both automakers'
global reach, our technology platform has the largest geographic deployment
potential of any self-driving technology to date.

At Argo AI, we believe that embracing differences delivers superior results.
We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to an inclusive
environment for all employees.

Job summary  
Excited about robotics, and how they will be used in our everyday lives? The
Amazon Consumer Robotics group is pushing the boundaries of what’s possible,
making the future closer than ever.  
  
Astro is Amazon’s first household robot to gracefully and intuitively interact
with people and spaces. It is a different kind of robot, one that’s designed
to help customers with a range of tasks like home monitoring and keeping in
touch with family. It brings together new advancements in artificial
intelligence, computer vision, sensor and motor technology, voice and edge
computing in a package that’s designed to be helpful and convenient.  
  
The Role  
As a Robotics and Controls Engineer you will be responsible for developing
solutions to control electro-mechanical systems. You will take responsibility
for developing models, performing analysis, producing and prototyping
algorithms for the control and estimation of robotic systems that guide and
inform mechanical and electrical designs, and software implementation. You
will demonstrate cross-functional resource interaction to accomplish your
goals. You will play a role in defining processes and methods to improve the
productivity of the entire team. You will investigate applicable academic and
industry research applications, identify and initiate investigations of
production technologies, prototype and test solutions to support product
features, and design and help validate production designs that deliver an
exceptional user experience.  
  
You will demonstrate strong analytical and working knowledge of physical
systems, the desire to learn from new challenges and the problem solving and
communication skills to work within a highly interactive and experienced team.
Candidates must show a hands-on passion for their work and be able to
communicate their ideas and concepts both verbally and visually. Candidates
must demonstrate an ability to integrate feedback and to respond quickly to
changing contexts and work environments. In this role, you will:  
  

  * Develop and prototype controls and estimation algorithms for robotic systems
  * Develop tests, perform failure analysis, and solution validation for product development
  * Conduct field failure analysis and solution evaluation for production product issues
  * Support positive team interactions to accomplish program objectives
  * Provide cross-functional program integration support to ensure team success
  * Commit to timely delivery of product features
  * Manage schedules and milestones
  * Apply technical expertise to problem solving throughout product lifecycle
  * Mentor junior engineers in good practice
  * PhD degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace or related field
  * Experience with motor control and firmware development
  * Deep understanding of the first principles to guide electro-mechanical system modeling
  * Deep understanding of state estimation methodologies using classical observers, Kalman Filter, etc.
  * Experience in designing controllers using Model Predictive Control, Optimal Control and Adaptive Control theory
  * Demonstrated influence in selection of sensors, actuators and electro-mechanical design
  * Demonstrated experience implementing controls in production systems
  * Demonstrated examples of implemented controls in high volume or consumer systems
  * Demonstrated leadership and mentoring skills
  * Experience with 3D CAD such as Solidworks, Creo or equivalent

**About Ample:**

Ample is an ambitious startup that is changing the way energy is delivered
into vehicles. The goal of our innovation is to make it easier for a much
wider range of users to own and operate an electric car. By weaving together
smart battery technology, robotics, and a better designed car-battery
interface, we are creating an Electric Vehicle (EV) infrastructure that is
fast, cheap, and generic across automotive manufacturers.

As a member of our team, you will help solve very complex challenges involving
electric vehicles, robotics and smart battery technology, by combining
creative tech design with fast iteration. The Ample team is small, intense,
highly capable and eager to have like-minded individuals to join our team. If
the technology doesn't exist, we're not afraid to invent it, while always
keeping in mind it must be designed for reliability, affordability and easy
deployment.

  

**In this new position, you will:**

  * Be hands-on to tackle and solve an array of practical electro-mechanical technical problems.
  * Implement cloud and client-side applications to coordinate the motion between multiple moving systems.
  * Create predictable movement patterns for robot-robot interactions.
  * Write thorough test procedures and tooling for validating production systems.
  * Communicate across mechanical, electrical, and software domains to investigate and understand underlying design decisions.

  * Understanding of sensor selection and data acquisition of LIDAR, Radar or Camera-based sensors and their usage in Object Detection, Classification, and Pose Estimation applications of a physical motion system.
  * Design and execution of navigation and controls for multi-axis motion systems.
  * Analysis and guidance of actuator loads, sizing and calibration. Understanding motor controller software interfaces and understanding of electromechanical interfaces.

  

**General Requirements**

  * Ability to take an abstract problem and break it down into an implementable system - starting with a scrappy approach and progressively building it up into a sophisticated solution.
  * Comfortable with debug, testing and verification at multiple levels of software development and system integration.
  * Thorough understanding of electromechanical and communication interfaces.
  * Comfortable with C++ software development.
  * Operational usage of source control and build tools such as Git and CMake
  * Minimum 2 years of industry experience in directly-related areas

To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you
want to bring groundbreaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every

electronics – our embedded engineers are the essential component that ties
these teams together. As an Embedded Software Engineer at Formlabs, you'll
collaborate with electrical engineers, systems engineers, and the rest of our
software team to build, shape, and define our embedded systems.

on real-world products, we want you to join our Embedded Software Engineering

## The Company

Miso Robotics is transforming the restaurant industry and making a real impact
on the world.

Miso Robotics is writing an epic new story for the restaurant industry. We've
developed a robotic kitchen assistant, Flippy, that can perform a variety of
kitchen tasks including flipping burgers and running the deep fryer. Our
product is a robotic arm on a rail that fits into existing kitchens along
existing cook lines and is designed to work with existing equipment alongside
kitchen workers. Under the hood, Flippy relies on our platform which combines
deep learning and other computer vision technologies with optimization-based
scheduling and nonlinear control to adapt quickly to a variety of kitchen
workflows, while achieving graceful and efficient motion.

The challenge of bringing robotics into commercial kitchens requires many
disciplines to come together. The compositions of teams at Miso Robotics
reflect this multidisciplinary nature of our work. We have built a world-class
team and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us. If you
believe, like we do, that the future of the kitchen involves robotics and
artificial intelligence (HINT: It definitely does) and if you want to count
yourself among the handful of lucky people who've found themselves with the
opportunity to solve this problem, then Miso Robotics might be the right place
for you!

##  The Role

Assuming the role of ML/Robotics Research Engineer puts you on the cusp of
advanced technology development. You will scout ahead, exploring the latest
ideas and technologies in Robotics, Machine Learning, IoT, Cloud Computing,
and Scalable Architectures. As a member of Research and Advanced Development,
you will interview team members and domain experts to help identify the
biggest opportunities and understand the most significant challenges. You will
regularly create prototype solutions, disseminate learnings through writings
and presentations, and continue to champion adoption as you hand these
prototypes off for production development.

You will work in many different domain areas so you must be able to learn
rapidly. You will collaborate on research partnerships with universities and
attend conferences as necessary to stay up to date on the latest developments.
You will combine broad knowledge in a variety of fields with expertise in
software development to bridge the gap between research and production.

##  What You’ll Do

In this role, you will:

  * Research and develop new theories in robotics and computer vision.
  * Design simulations to validate vision and control strategies.
  * Build and maintain tools to improve development efficiency.
  * Review approaches, algorithms, and architectural diagrams and provide helpful feedback.
  * Take on problems and research the solution space to find several reasonable solutions.
  * Create high-quality rapid prototypes to demonstrate new concepts and technologies.
  * Create unit tests and system-level tests to verify code functionality.
  * Create diagrams and documentation to communicate to a wide audience of developers.
  * Create documentation to help identify and clarify functional requirements.
  * Develop a strong systems-level understanding of our products.
  * Performs other related duties as assigned.

##  What You Need in Order to Succeed in this Role

#####  Technical Requirements

  * Bachelor’s Degree in Robotics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
  * 3+ years experience in developing software in Python.
  * 3+ years experience with ROS (Robot Operating System).
  * 3+ years experience with ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
  * Experience solving controls problems with multi-DoF robots.
  * Experience solving robotics vision problems with machine learning.
  * Strong working knowledge of Linux, Git, and Docker.
  * Experience working with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS or Azure.

Other Requirements

  * Superb oral and written communication skills.
  * Ability to collaborate effectively with a team.
  * Ability to adapt your coding style to our internal style.
  * Willingness and eagerness to share your opinions on problems and solutions.
  * Proclivity for staying up to date with best practices.
  * Great at managing multiple tasks and getting stuff done in a fast-paced environment.
  * Strong attention to detail, analytical skills and ability to learn at hyperspeed.
  * Obsession with clarity.
  * Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

##  Benefits and Perks

  * Unlimited PTO policy
  * Comprehensive benefits offerings
  * 401K plan
  * Education reimbursement program
  * Competitive pay
  * Advancement opportunities

**_Robotics Software Test Engineer_**

Full time position based in Pasadena, CA

 _OffWorld is a robotics startup working on developing a mobile robotic
workforce for heavy industrial jobs on Earth, Moon, asteroids & Mars. OffWorld
was founded by an experienced engineering team drawing on decades of tackling
formidable engineering challenges at NASA, ESA, NOAA, Maxar Technologies,
CERN, Reaction Engines, SAFRAN, Surrey Satellites and Cisco. OffWorld’s first
challenge is developing and maturing a modular robotic system for extreme
environments on Earth. Our robots will go deeper underground and farthest on
Earth than humans can, eliminate the need for humans to work in life-
threatening environments in mining, construction, tunneling and other
dangerous industries, and dramatically reduce the environmental footprint and
cost of operations in key economies on Earth and beyond._

We have designed a modular robotic architecture that focuses on maximizing the
commonality and reusability across components for fast deployment and
optimization. Our robotic systems combine sensory information with cutting
edge machine learning (ML) for control and decision making.

We are currently looking for a Robotics Test Engineer who will be responsible
for the operational testing and optimization of our robots. You will work with
the mechatronics, software & controls and machine learning engineers to
validate and improve the autonomous operation of the robots, developing tests
plans to validate requirements and functionality from the ground up. You will
participate in lab and field testing activities, including testing of robots
in extreme environments (green fields, mines and construction sites).

For this role, you should be comfortable with main robotics concepts and
software tools, including tele-operating and troubleshooting robotic software
systems in an academic, lab or field setting. Experience with the
teleoperation of complex systems in the aviation, space, high energy or
equivalent industries, is highly applicable. Familiarity with data analysis
and test debugging is required. Practical experience with Python and the ROS
environment is highly valued. A working knowledge to operate and maintain
mechanical, electronic, and electro-mechanical components and interfaces is
desired.

You should be comfortable working on the field with heavy duty robotic systems
or machines, where safety is paramount.

  

To hit the ground running, you will need experience in the following:

  * Use of software tools for functional validation and verification of operational capabilities (JIRA, Requirements tracking systems)
  * Executing and maintaining development or test environments in Ubuntu OS, including strong knowledge of the Ubuntu OS and terminal based programming
  * ROS, Python, C++, Docker, HTTP API 
  * Version control software such as Git and SVM
  * Telemetry processing/time series databases and graphical visualization tools (Grafana, influx or equivalent) 
  * Troubleshooting software using logs and software debugging tools 
  * Developing automated test scripts and test scripting in general
  * CI/CD pipelines (such as Jenkins) for robotic software development is highly desired
  * Robotics hardware integration and testing and mechatronics practical experience is highly desired (mechanical and electrical testing, CAD/PCB Layout, Embedded Software/Assembly)

  
The following qualifications are required:

  * BSc or higher in Mechanical Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, Mechatronics or equivalent with at least 2 years of experience
  * Excellent verbal and written/online communication skills
  * Team player with a hands-on mentality
  * Demonstrated ability to manage, organize and reprioritize your work to meet deadlines and support the entire organization. Comfortable multi-tasking/working on different projects concurrently.
  * Passionate about solving riddles, critical thinker, able to analyze complex data
  * Self-driven, passionate, and constantly pursuing knowledge and excellence
  * Nothing-is-impossible attitude

  
In a nutshell, we offer:

  * Opportunity to sink your teeth into cutting edge industrial robotics problems
  * Opportunity to contribute to the mission of transforming how we mine on Earth today and how we will one day mine on the Moon, asteroids & Mars
  * Opportunity to attend relevant conferences in the line of research
  * Competitive package
  * Offer to join the OffWorld team full-time-if 
    * You are as crazy-excited about the mission as we are
    * You’ve demonstrated you are The Right Stuff

Job Title: Software Engineer III, Robotics, Google Research
Job Description:
Minimum qualifications:

  * Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  * 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree. 
  * 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.

  

Preferred qualifications:

  * Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
  * 2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, and/or natural language processing.
  * Post graduate work experience on Robotics, ML, or related technical fields.
  * Experience developing accessible technologies.
  * Experience developing software solutions to work on Robots.
  * Experience developing machine learning training infrastructure and deployment.

## **About the job**

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that
change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information
and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and
extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh
ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing,
large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial
intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes
on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a
specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams
and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our
engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to
take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology
forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines,
and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and
enhance software solutions for Robotics.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and
tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product
development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used
by billions of people every day.  
  
Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our
approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field - we
publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and
apply research to Google products.

##  **Responsibilities**

  * Work with researchers and other team members to integrate novel solutions that advance Robotics.
  * Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies. 
  * Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency). 
  * Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback. 
  * Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to
explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can
be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its
culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand
seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person
bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.

Innovation is oxygen for NIKE, Inc., and the company depends on its talented,
global workforce to breathe originality and curiosity into everything they do.
The Nike Advanced Innovation team strives for lighter, faster, bigger,
smarter, smaller, more efficient, more sustainable and more personal. They
imagine, research, analyze and invent the next industry-changing technology to
advance athletic performance. In roles that span research, design, materials
and manufacturing, the Advanced Innovation team looks to the future and
focuses on making the seemingly impossible, possible.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are seeking a curious and dedicated Lead Robotics Engineer to join our
team, an engineer with skills across mechanical, electrical and software and a
specific passion for robotics. Your hands-on experiences with machine design,
system development and product integration will be the foundation for the
strategies you create to build new capabilities in our R&D setting. A track-
record of self-directed learning and collaborative problem-solving is
essential. Creating complex systems in a rapidly changing environment will
expose challenges that do not have a clear solution-path. Part of your role
will be landscaping and researching new hardware, software and controls tools
and becoming a domain expert in those areas. This is a Lead role and as such
you will be expected to plan and complete strategies that leverage your
expertise and develop team members both within and outside the Automation and
Robotics function.

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON

If this is you, you will be assigned to multiple concurrent programs and act
as an automation knowledge-base and resource to those teams, clearly
communicating and explaining automation and robotics capabilities/limitations
in both technical and non-technical manners. You will actively seek to
understand and interpret program objectives and you will be responsible for
translating those objectives into machine requirements and developing
solutions to meet those requirements through an iterative, collaborative and
data-driven approach.

Many of the solutions you identify will be electromechanical systems which
include robotics, computer vision, sensors and microcontrollers. In early-
stage programs, you will design and build machine prototypes to test your
ideas and provide a platform for Process Engineers to define key process
variables and interactions.

As programs progress, you will continue to develop the core robotics modules
and peripheral systems through both hands-on creation and through external
partnerships you lead. You will run machine landscaping activities for
potential off-the-shelf components and sub-systems and partner with Business
Development, Legal and Procurement functions to draft agreements with
strategic partners and purchase equipment.

After you validate and train others on the new systems, you will continue to
support the teams by solving problems and upgrading the systems in
development, in-particular the software and controls components handling
motion and data acquisition. Throughout this journey you will use functional
processes and best-practices and identify improvements to these tools that can
enable the team to work more efficiently.

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

You will be working in a premier R&D facility with a dedicated machine shop,
testing lab and product creation team to assist you. You'll have support in
embracing the hands-on parts of your role (fabricating, assembling, coding,
testing) with a growth-mindset approach and a hunger to learn. You will also
partner with Technical Program Managers, Process Engineers and Technicians as
your project core-team members as well as Materials and Software experts where
appropriate. Collaborating with these functions and standing-up new
capabilities in Innovation rewards system-based thinking and interdisciplinary
problem-solving. You won't have all the answers, but you'll be able to ask
good questions across a variety of subject-areas.

  

WHAT YOU BRING

  * Bachelor's or higher degree in Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Mechatronics or similarly related engineering field or a combination of relevant education, experience, and training
  * 5+ years of applied experience in system design, integration of hardware solutions, robotics, or other mechatronics roles
  * Experience as a technical lead within a multi-disciplinary team that includes vendors, integrators, and software engineers
  * Demonstrated track-record as a self-directed learner
  * Ability to move fast and work with incomplete information
  * Experience programming industrial robots (ABB, B&R, or ROS Industrial a plus)
  * Experience programming microcomputers and microcontrollers (Raspberry Pi, Arduino)
  * Experience in one or more programming languages (Python or C++ a plus)
  * Comfortable with hands-on fabrication and assembly
  * Industrial electrical control panel design and assembly experience a plus
  * Software version control experience a plus
  * Computer vision experience a plus
  * Ability to dream, think, solve, and grow
  * We know that not everyone receives the same professional or educational opportunities. If there are requirements listed above that you are working towards or would like to persue and you think you would be a good fit, please apply!

Job summary  
Excited about robotics, and how they will be used in our everyday lives? The
Amazon Consumer Robotics group brings together new advancements in artificial
intelligence, computer vision, sensor and motor technology, voice and edge
computing to push the boundaries of what’s possible.  
  
The Role  
As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will work cross-functionally with other
exceptional engineers to develop robust and efficient firmware solutions. Our
technology team delivers firmware for controlling and interfacing with
Amazon’s latest consumer devices, including consumer robotics. We are looking
for driven software engineers with a passion for working hands-on with
electromechanical systems and turning their ideas into reality to join our
team. Your work will have a direct impact on getting Amazon’s next generation
of products into the hands of millions of customers.  
  
If you have a passion for creating, learning in a dynamic, fast-paced
environment, and writing code that brings hardware to life, come join us and
see what we’re building next!  
  
In this role, you will:  

  * Design, develop, test and deploy firmware for ARM microcontrollers and other embedded systems
  * Apply your experience of designs and approaches to define the right technical solution for the challenging problems of embedded systems
  * Follow industry best practices, participate in design/code reviews and continuously gather feedback to develop robust and maintainable software
  * Prototype new and innovative solutions for Amazon’s consumer electronic devices
  * Understand cross-functional requirements, and identify missing requirements to ensure successful integrations
  * Build technical expertise to problem solve throughout the product development lifecycle
  * Grow as a software engineer by seeking out mentorship and learning from peers
  * Mentor junior engineers in good practice, and participate in hiring of new team members

  

  * 3+ years of professional experience developing embedded software on low-level processors (RTOS or bare metal)
  * Experience with developing software for ARM Cortex M series MCUs
  * Proven track record of independently delivering firmware solutions to challenging problems
  * Experience working cross-functionally with large groups to deliver a product
  * Experience with electromechanical systems, sensors, actuators, robotics, etc.

Our vision is to deliver high-quality homes, faster and more affordable,
making the American dream of homeownership more accessible for everyone.

Our company is working to revolutionize the home building industry by
deploying unique automation technologies combined with a deep level of
robotics, people, and software integration. We are seeking an experienced,
resourceful full-stack software engineer who can make an impact on day one.

Our company is headquartered in Phoenix, building homes through Arizona, with
regional and national expansion plans in the next 24 months.

As part of our company, you will be integral to the success of the company as
we bring our homes to market in the Phoenix area. Partnering with all of the
core technical teams, you will be deeply involved in designing, testing, and
building the systems that construct our homes.

 **The Role:**

As a Robotics Software Engineer, you will report to the Head of Software and
Controls Engineering and support the development of proprietary software that
automates various tasks required for home construction. You will be part of a
dynamic and mission-critical team that is responsible for designing a rapidly
deployable robotic system that can accurately automate an arbitrary set of
procedurally generated operations.

You will directly contribute to the state-of-the-art in the robotics field by
developing software that allows a house-sized system to perform accurate tasks
on a field-deployed deformable gantry in an outdoor dynamic environment.

 **Duties & Responsibilities: **

  * Design, build, test, and deploy software for robotic systems
  * Develop algorithms across various robotics disciplines e.g. localization, planning, and perception across the full design lifecycle: requirements, design, code, test, integrate
  * Contribute to system architecture design for a state-of-the-art robotic system that leverages an industrial manipulator to execute an arbitrary set of procedurally generated tasks
  * Identify, integrate, and test off-the-shelf industrial automation solutions and advise on in-house development opportunities
  * Undertake travel as necessary to support customer deployments

 **Qualifications:**

 _Required:_

  * Practical experience with GoLang, C++, and Python
  * Coursework or experience with describing robot rigid body motion e.g. homogenous transformation matrices, transformation trees, quaternions
  * Coursework or experience with forward and inverse kinematics for redundant manipulators
  * Experience with ROS-based software development for robotic systems
  * Experience implementing robotic programs from a major industrial robot arm manufacturer e.g. Fanuc, Yaskawa, Kuka
  * Knowledge of Ethernet IP / TCP / UDP / Serial communication
  * Demonstrated ability to work on software codebases with multiple contributors

 _Ideal:_

  * Demonstrated expertise in a fundamental robotics discipline e.g. localization, planning, perception, or control
  * Integration of open source libraries such as MoveIt, OpenCV, the Point Cloud Library (PCL) and/or similar packages
  * Coursework or experience with motion planning for redundant manipulators
  * Experience with closed-chain parallel mechanisms e.g. Stewart-Gough platform * Comfortable working alongside large scale industrial machinery in a safe and effective manner
  * Familiarity with modern software architecture and tools such as databases, containerized application deployment, micro-services, and source control

Vicarious aims to transform robotics by creating robots with human level

to join us in that mission.

  
As a Robotics Test Engineer, your role will be to ensure that our robots
correctly execute their mission under the varying conditions that exist at
different customer sites.

### **What you'll do**

  * Execute intensive testing of robots and its subsystems
  * Work with QA engineers to create and execute validation plans
  * Evaluate results of testing and highlight areas for improvement
  * Track, identify and communicate software and hardware defects
  * Develop and maintain a robust system to track test resources
  * Write clear and concise documentation of procedures, results, and reports
  * Suggest and oversee improvements to process and testing methodology
  * Design and implement tooling to make testing more efficient and streamlined
  * Collaborate across teams to improve performance of robot systems

###  **Who you are**

  * Familiar with software management tools such as Github, JIRA etc
  * Experience with Linux
  * Experience with bug lifecycle management

  * Self-starter
  * Exposure to software development and preferably some experience writing test scripts
  * Comfortable working in a team environment
  * Excellent communication skills and ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds
  * Passionate about robotics and artificial intelligence, and excited to push the boundaries on real-world robotics applications

###  **Bonus qualifications**

**OVERVIEW**

At Cambridge Consultants we get to tackle some of the toughest problems faced
by the medical industry. Our clients range from small start-ups to large
multinationals all over the world. The technology that we encounter and build
in our work varies from one project to the next as we aim to advance the
state-of-the-art in healthcare. Your talent and depth of experience in
developing novel robotic control systems is what will be behind tomorrow’s
computer-assisted surgical tools and medical devices.

 **YOUR ROLE**

Cambridge Consultants is a technical consultancy with hundreds of world-class
engineers. We take on a large variety of challenging projects with a focus on
delivering breakthrough innovations. As a Senior Robotic Controls Engineer,
you will get the opportunity to learn new skills and work in diverse
applications with a wide range of technologies including hyperspectral
imaging, advanced robotic manipulators, and machine learning. In this role,
you will help create the next generation of medical devices ranging from
surgical navigation and advanced visualization to intelligent robotic systems
for the future of digital surgery. Each project is a new opportunity to learn
and deliver.

 **DAY TO DAY:**

  * Contribute to early-stage development through analysis of novel concepts.
  * Perform rigorous kinematic and dynamic modelling and simulation.
  * Develop and test control algorithms for complex electromechanical systems.
  * Work closely with the mechanical design team to develop mechanisms to meet aggressive performance targets.
  * Lead discipline expertise in robotic system control algorithms, modelling, simulation, and optimization within cross-functional teams.
  * Lead and support internal efforts to develop new technology offerings.

 **WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED**

 **MUST HAVE:**

MS or Ph.D (preferred) in engineering with an emphasis on robotics, dynamics,
controls, or equivalent degree

  * Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship
  * Excellent communication skills
  * Deep knowledge of robot manipulator kinematics and dynamics
  * Matlab and either C++ (preferred) or python programming skills
  * Experience with ROS

 **BONUS POINTS:**

  * Experience with tele-operated robotic systems
  * Experience in continuum robotics
  * Experience with surgical applications
  * Experience with real-time software applications and RTOS
  * Knowledge of probabilistic, computer vision, or machine learning techniques
